Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Glenda S
Reviews.Content: We took the train from Barcelona to Madrid for 2 nights. We left one Derby hotel (fabulous) in Barcelona and went to this Derby hotel, the Urban in Madrid. A ten-minute cab ride from the train station, a ten minute walk from The Prado and Thyssen museums. Fifteen minute walk to Retiro Park with lots of markets, plazas and restaurants in the area. It was perfect!! Service was exceptional and although our room was on the street it was extremely quiet. I will recommend this hotel to everyone and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: artsfan99
Reviews.Content: A lovely place to stay, beautiful design, helpful and friendly staff and perfectly located for sight-seeing

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AJHTelAviv
Reviews.Content: this is a great hotel especially for a couple. the rooms are very nice and the bathroom is extra plush. the staff is extremely friendly and the location couldn't be better. walking distance from almost anywhere you want to get. the only disadvantages were the fitness room which is way too basic and does not fit the standard of this hotel. i would expect a much better fitness room. and the other thing that was not that great is the layout of the junior suite. it is a loft design which is cool on the outset, but in reality you don't really use the upper level all that much and the space is pretty wasted. i would prefer a larger room on a single level. the bar is great as well!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: noa s Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great location, small rooms but clean and good service it is close to every where metro station is close to the hotel staff are nice

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip to Madrid”
Reviews.Author: dave2105
Reviews.Content: Great location, quite a stylish hotel. Enjoyed my stay, but felt the facilities didn't warrant a 5* hotel. Very small gym, not a great breakfast. Apparently Real Madrid footballers frequent the bar, but not during my stay. Some wonderful Tapas bars in the old streets behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, definitely 5 star!!”
Reviews.Author: KTaylor55
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect from the straightforward check in to the beautiful room, complimentary champagne and amazing breakfast which when we visited, had a promotional discount. We stayed for two nights and couldn't fault this hotel. We had originally booked with booking.com but a few days before we were going I noticed that the hotel group were offering a 20% discount for 2 night stays. So we cancelled the original booking and rebooked immediately with the derby hotel group. The terrace and pool area was closed because it was early in their season but it looked great and in the height of the season would be very necessary. We were travelling out of Madrid to Toledo and Salamance and stayed at two other hotels in Madrid during the week, both in the Melia group and both very similar prices to the Urban. Neither of these hotels came anywhere near the standard of the Urban. If we ever return to Madrid we would definitely rebook the Urban.

Reviews.Title: “Something different...”
Reviews.Author: messin73
Reviews.Content: I have spent 3 nights there in September, 2011. What I really liked was the design, and the comfort. The hotel has a friendly ambience, great and polite staff, super pool area on the roof (I verz much liked the architectural solutions in the hotel, e.g. stairs to the roof.) Rooms are big, comfortable, flower on the table... Great breakfast cold and warm, fresh juice, good coffee. And very good location, right in the city center. Onlz one thing that I did not like: thanks to the super design, I could not find anything in the wardrobe, as it was a bit dark in that part of the room... I warmly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star WOW For Urban Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: DKJAXFL
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel you have! What a fabulous staff you have! What an exceptional stay we had! I wanted to thank you personally for extending so many courtesy’s to us on our anniversary stay in Madrid. Champagne at the bar, Champagne in our room – roses… a lovely room! All I can do is shower you all with thanks! From doorman to front desk, from wait staff in the great restaurant to wonderful housekeeping personnel… all superior! We look forward to additional stays at the Derby’s in London – Paris – Barcelona and maybe even a return trip to the elegant Urban in Madrid. I have already alerted all of our friends that are traveling to visit you all! Facebook is buzzing about our wonderful visit. Please extend our thanks to your entire staff! Regards, DK

Reviews.Title: “Wi-fi woes spoil stay!”
Reviews.Author: Timetraveller_12
Reviews.Content: The hardware and the wet ware at the Urban are good, but the software lets them down badly. I am staying there now in a suite and have to pay 13 euros a day for wi-fi! And this is for each device!! So with an iPhone, an iPad and a Mac, it is mighty expensive. I moved here from the Hotel Hospes because the internet was too slow. Frankly I wish i hadn't and would move out now but for all the hassle of doing so. I am in Madrid to work. To be charged for wi-fi in this day and age is ridiculous but 13 euros a day for EACH device is almost criminal. My protestations are met with the usual, 'it is company policy', and 'you are not the first to complain', remarks. OK, so fix it!! I will not stay here again until it is fixed or any other hotel that charges for wi-fi. I stay over 100 nights a year in hotels all over the world and thankfully this kind of old fashioned, 'rip the guest off' attitude is over in most hotels in most countries. I can get free wi-fi all over China, so why not here in Spain. Time for Derby Hotels to rethink its 'policy' and get real.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Design, Great Location, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: jnsnsf
Reviews.Content: some hotels build for "all show, no go" which is definitely not the case with this hotel. The photos do not do it justice. The design and build out of the rooms and lobby is top notch with many details that were surely expensive to execute but done anyway. I love that there is no carpet in the hallway or rooms. Nice bar, social spaces. we were in a two-level. Wish the wifi was free. Upstairs is nice working space. Close to banks, museums and the park which is excellent for running.

Reviews.Title: “The most excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: hoyaLA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Urban for 4 days during my business trip to Madrid. I know Madrid very well and have stayed at most 5 star hotels in Madrid but this was the first time I stayed in Urban, and from now on I will most definitely stay there. It is an exceptional hotel, with great service, the best bar in Madrid, and it is located 5 to 10 min walk from any of the sights in Madrid. However, if you are looking for a hotel that also has a gym, this is not your place then. It has a small very basic gym with free weights up to 10 kg, a bike, and an elliptical.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel within historic area”
Reviews.Author: MichaelKoch66
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the center plaza in Madrid, often referred to as the "center of Spain". Walking distance to just about everything, you can shop, eat, or just take in the sites within a 5 minute walk. The hotel is very modern and is exceptionally designed and built. The staff is warm and friendly, and that is what Spain is. Late night drinks in the bar are terrific, but here is your warning: the plaza nearby is the home of multiple large scale demonstrations lately. Avoid if possible during these times as riot control police are prevalent. Be careful here at night as well, but most people in the streets are friendly and the local restaurants are really really good.

Reviews.Title: “A contemporary hotel in the centre of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: StreamsUK
Reviews.Content: A cool, contemporary hotel in the governmental district of Madrid. A great place to stay but very masculine in its style and furnishings, which I loved. Helpful and friendly staff and a cool bar and terrace on the roof with great views and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “has a lot to offer, not for young families”
Reviews.Author: ripandburn
Reviews.Content: i mean that it doesnt have any family rooms or sofa beds but its sister hotel does. urban has a great location , 5 mins from the centre on foot, lots of restuarants and it has a roof top pool,small gym and great breakfast. no wi fi but has free fixed internet. good rooms and decor, clean and staff are friendly. i didnt eat dinner/lunch there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: GourgourGT
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect location with interesting and nicely decorated rooms, while the price of the room is competitive to other comparable luxury hotels in the center. A couple of negative points, however: 1) the front desk service is mediocre or rather close to bad, with employees who have a bad command of English. 2) At the time of our visit, there was construction near by that woke us up at 8 am.

Reviews.Title: “Choose a vertikal!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PiroskaOslo
Reviews.Content: Went here with my daughter! 4 nights. We had a vertical room. SUPERB!!! One of the best rooms I ever stayed in! Lounge area on the top . Walk in closet . Lovely bathroom! Everything fine! Perfect position for everything! We got a glass of Champagne in the bar when we arrived,some Maki rolls for free to . THANK YOU!!!! The reception helped us to book restaurants and gave guide to the town. They were very service minded and kind. I recommend this hotel! it is nice for sure in the summer with the pool on the roof top. Only negative is the gym,smallest in the world!!!!!! Do not travel here for the gym!!!! It is nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific combination of the old and the new”
Reviews.Author: mobert
Reviews.Content: This review is a bit late since we spent 5 nights at this hotel in April 2011; however I wanted to add my voice to those who enjoyed their stay. We found this hotel by accident - we were staying nearby and didn't like the accomodations so we ventured forth to find something better. And we did right from the get go. I went up to the front desk, explained we were unhappy with our current hotel and could they offer something better? Of course they answered! We were shown both a regular room and junior suite and offered a discount. We reserved the suite and checked in the next day. Let me say the suites are beautiful - very modern, spacious, and comfortable and decorated with antiquities. That's right - this modern hotel was started by an archaeologist and is decorated with various forms of primitive art. There is even a small museum on the lower floor! Unique and cool! I had never stayed in this combination before. Other things to love - computers right off the lobby offering free internet access, a great location only steps from the Retiro, Prado museum, and Gran Via. The only reason I'm giving four stars as opposed to five is the pool is a bit small and the gym not much to speak of. But other than that, I strongly recommend this property and would go back in a minute. Ole!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and stylish”
Reviews.Author: Scarletdiv
Reviews.Content: Been stayin for several nights in July. The hotel was great. The design of common areas, lovely rooftop pool (!!!) and resto, marble bathroom and stylish room. I could mention some turn offs (like a bit unfriendly stuff and chambermaids, overpriced breakfast) but not for the lovely price they offered at the high season for pride :) HIGHLY recommended if u get a good deal))

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: cytraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the third time while on a business trip to Madrid. Always enjoy staying here it has a great feel and great service. Very conveniently located. The glass bar is also a must and the roof top bar also great in the summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: jfloMiami_FL
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in December for 3 days, third time I have stayed here and I like the hotel even more after trying a few other hotels in Madrid. I was there for business and I got a very good rate, the location is perfect as both tourist and for business. You are within walking distance to the Museums, Plaza del Sol, Plaza Santa Ana, theaters, parque Retiro plus a short metro ride to the rest of the city. Plenty of good bars/restaurants within a few blocks as well. The rooms are good size, great, modern and very well equiptted. The bed was extremely comfortable and the rooms were nice and quiet. THe bathrooms are modern and luxurious. The only slight drawback in the room is there is no dedicated business desk, but that is not a problem as there is a nice couch and side table that works just fine for business needs. The staff was amazing, the staff let me have an early checking after an overnight flight, and the bar downstairs, I think its called Glass?, is great with good bartenders. In the summer, the upstairs pool/patio area becomes a happening spot in the evenings. I will definately be staying here again, and it suits both business and tourist stays.

Reviews.Title: “Useless concierge , very noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Wassim5
Reviews.Content: We visited Madrid over New Year's and stayed at the Urban . Very nice Design hotel and fantastic location , the Architect deserves and award for that ...but this is where it ends . Little did we know that Madrid grinds to a total halt over New Year(restaurants , bars , shops...) so a competent concierge could have saved the day . Unfortunatly they didn't . They had no clue which restaurants to recommend for the NY eve's party or any other restaurant for that matter. They spoke very little English also . the situation was getting pretty desperate because even the hotel's restaurant closed on Jan 1st !! unheard of and i know , i travelled the world . The one time they actually booked us a restaurant , they gave us the wrong address so we ended up somwehere else . If you decide to stay at the Urban avoid suite 131 , we were like living in the Lobby . The suite doesn't get any natural light and its windows overlook the reception counter so whenever in the room we had to keep the drapes closed for some privacy but that didn't take care of all the noise . Furthermore , since the lobby doesn't have any proper seating area guests used the seating area outside room 131 so it's a bit of a bus stop . The only thing i can recommed is the Bar . Excellent staff , great drinks , good prices and fantatstic Chips .

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel , Sleek Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Jayda L
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and loved every minute of it. From the fantastic staff at reception to walking into my room and being delighted. The room was very sleek and modern and was cleaned very well. The pool on the roof of the hotel although small was a great spot to soak up the midday sun, and the poolside bar service was a great way to spend a day. The lobby was very nice and you can get good view going up in the glass lifts.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Art-Deco setting with an Egyptian touch”
Reviews.Author: Monica S
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting Madrid and feel the need to splurge on accommodation, ignoring the countless extremely convenient hostels surrounding the centre, then this is your best bet. If you like an extremely modern Art-Deco design with an Egyptian touch to it, then you will love this place! I stayed there for three nights and it was a delightful experience. Apart from the fact that it took me 15 minutes to figure out how to turn off all the lights and another 10 to turn on the shower in four different ways – it was great. A lady arranged the room each day with roses, the traditional sweet in shape of an egg on the bed, El Pais newspaper hanging from the door and so on. Not only that, but it’s in the best location possible, in Sol, where everything is. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel in a fantastic town”
Reviews.Author: serandreica'pisani
Reviews.Content: I had the chance to stay 3 nights with my niece last week and we both had a very nice stay. the hotel is centrally located, a few minutes' walk from the 'Prado' and near plaza del Sol, close to the metro and many restaurants and locals, including 'Lhardy' where we bought some very tasty pastries. the staff is professional and kind, in the breakfast room they greet you asking if you want some squeezed orange juice and tea or coffee as soon as you seat. they have a tiny gym on the last floor, but be aware that even if it is heated, to get inside you need to walk 15 metres in the winter temperatures because the last floor is partially opened (and in fact the emergency stairs are pretty cold because all the air comes down along them). we did not have the chance to try their restaurant, but had something to drink and eat on our arrival, and it was pretty good (and with fashionable and trendy guests!) should I be back to Madrid, I will probably stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very confortable and central”
Reviews.Author: paulus70
Reviews.Content: I went for a weekend stayed for a saturday night and i loved the room , the tub in the bathroom was wonderful, the glass walls amazing. The breakfast average. Great location. Very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: PassportandVisa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in Oct 2011 in a duplex suite. The room was fantastic, the two level design felt very spacious and had a great design. The public spaces of the hotel look like an indigenous art museum and Glass Bar downstairs is a nice place for a drink after seeing the sights. The hotel is within walking distance to most points of interest in Madrid. Our room did have some noise from a bar along Carrera San Geronimo but was easily remedied by closing all the blinds and shades. I recommend this hotel without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Trendy Place To Be Seen In Madrid”
Reviews.Author: shaunymac13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the urban between 23-26 October and had a fab 3 days. Hotel was extremely hip and trendy and the staff were fabulous. We stayed in a Duplex Jnr suite which is definately worth the extra money. It has an upstairs lounge area (sofa, minibar,plasma Etc). The Glass bar was bustling every night and had a great atmosphere (lots of champagne being drunk by all). We visited the Westin and Ritz for meals, however they are old world luxury and not for me. The Urban appeared to be THE place to be in Madrid and i wouldn't stay anywhere else if i was to return to Madrid. Special Thanks to 2 staff members who's names i did not catch. The female receptionist who arranged a special engagement meal at the Westin (she said Yes) and the Doorman who was extremely helpful everyday and always had a smile on his face.

Reviews.Title: “Well Appointed”
Reviews.Author: Crabit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an incredible piece of modern art. Superb appointments through out the hotel and rooms make this a unique experience. Luxurious and located in the heart of town. There is an amazing collection of African art throughout the structure. The roof top bar and pool give an excellent place to get away from the crowds. I have been here twice, because the first visit just wasn't enough.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: RKOesch
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 4 nights stay at this beautifully designed hotel. The concierge was very friendly and gave us a lot of very helpful information about the city. Our tastefully decorated superior room with a good size bathroom made us feel very comfortable during our stay. The location is also perfect. We highly recommend this unique and charming hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I like this hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: marumba_11
Reviews.Content: We decided to go for a suite at this hotel, not a junior suite, but a larger one. The suite was on the fifth floor and was promised to be sound proofed in the details. I liked the hotel and I liked the suite ,it seemed clean and nice, the decor was good and I was quite happy. Although we then noticed a nasty water mark on the wall and some leak/flood marks on the bathroom ceiling which should have been attended to considering the price of the room. Unfortunately our suite was directly below the bar and on the thursday and particularly on the friday night we were kept awake till 4 in the morning by loud noisy scraping and moving of furniture along the floor above our heads. It was so loud that it just seemed surreal. The bar closed at 3 in the morning but unbelievably the noise kept going after that. Eventually I decided to investigate and got dressed and went up to the bar which was on the roof terrace. I was met by shocked faces of some men clearing up as i tried to explain to them that we were trying to sleep underneath in the floor below. They looked suitably embarassed and i then returned to my room where we then managed to get some sleep. I later found out Sherlock Holmes style that there was a storage cupboard for the bar, directly above our room which must have been where the strange scraping and moving of furniture noises were coming from! As this had kept us awake on the thursday and especially on the friday we asked to be moved. To their credit the front desk did immediately move us to an identical suite on a quieter floor, but since we had lost sleep and then had to repack all our stuff I felt I had to ask for a discount and we were given 20 percent off those first two nights. The rest of our stay was fine but why put one of your supposedly best hotel suites below a very noisy part of the hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Would stay her again”
Reviews.Author: martinport
Reviews.Content: Welcome was perfect. Rooms are amazing very modern and high spech. Food is excellent specially there ala carte restaurant. Only complaint is the matress on the bed! Location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ssinc
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in the Urban, the last time was 4 years ago. This time we were there for 5 nights so booked a duplex suite to get a bit more space. On arrival the hotel staff were very friendly and welcoming. We chatted about the hotel and Madrid. We were also given vouchers for some champagne in the hotel. Check in was very quick and simple. First impression of the room was that it was very dark. The downstairs bedroom was ok, but the window overlooked the building next door and the darkness made it feel small. Also downstairs was the bathroom and a walk in cupboard. The bathroom was a good size and was very clean. The cupboard was very big and there was plenty room to keep all our luggage. The upstairs living room was a good size and was a comfortable, bright space to sit. There were televisions in the upstairs and downstairs rooms but there were only a couple of English language channels and the picture quality was really bad. We didn't spend a lot of time in the room, but when we were there we didn't really have the option of watching tv. Some of the booking websites state that the rooms have DVD and CD players, but our room didn't. The room is looking a bit worn in places, but overall it was a good room. There is a charge for wifi in this hotel which is surprising as most hotels offer it free. There are 2 computers beside reception for guests to use, but one of them seemed to be in constant use when we were there and the other didn't work very well, there were keyboard problems that the reception staff couldn't really help with. We didn't eat at the hotel. We went to the rooftop bar for our free champagne on the day we arrived, it was still open due to the extended good weather. It was a lovely place to sit and have a quiet drink, I would recommend that for the bar. We didn't use the pool. The glass bar on the ground floor was very busy on our first night. We decided to go there on our second night after we'd been out. It was quiet, there were only a few other people in the bar when we got there and one person when we left, it lacked atmosphere. The hotel location is excellent, you can easily walk around the city from here. I enjoyed my stay here and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KiwiTravler
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is fantastic. It is our second stay. The reception staff are very helpful. Rooms are great, the location is good everything is walking distance. If you like Jazz visit a place near by called Cafe Central.we had a great night there.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great spot”
Reviews.Author: Doogie5511
Reviews.Content: I was staying on business in Madrid at the Gran Melia Fenix and tacked a few extra days onto my trip for personal time. There was no room at the Fenix for my extra days so I decided on the Urban Hotel. It's a tough comparison as the Fenix is very, very nice. One of the attractions of this hotel for me was the rooftop bar and pool. I had planned to spend a bit of time relaxing by the pool when I wasn't sight-seeing. As it turns out, the pool doesn't get that much sun and it's really quite small. It's probably best to think of it as more of a cosmetic feature for the bar at night. The rooftop is an excellent place to end an evening in Madrid in the summer. My room was as hip and modern in design as the rest of the hotel. In some cases form takes priority over function which irks me a bit but maybe I'm just getting old. For example they use designer phones which don't have any of the extensions marked on them so you have to hunt for the little book to tell you what button to push for room service. That being said, if you are the type to go to New York and stay at a W rather than the Waldorf, this place is likely for you. The location is ideal, with the Prado just 5 minutes walk in one direction and a beautiful plaza about 10 minutes in the other direction. One complaint I had was the construction going on in the building directly next door and immediately outside my window. Between jet lag and late nights I was sleeping in a fair bit and the noise was significant. If you plan to stay here in or around October 2011 I would request a room on the other side of the building. Overall a great experience..

Reviews.Title: “Expensive hotel though great service”
Reviews.Author: as1707
Reviews.Content: As soon as I arrived, I was made to feel special as you expect in a 5*, but the hotel is expensive. The welcome comp champagne in the glass bar was nice. The rooms were stylishly furnished, but due to the hotel location there is no view at all. Swimming pool was smaller than expected and no one was really there apart from occasional sunbathers. The breakfast was ok, same as what you would have in 4*, I had to order a toast as oppose to going to a toaster and having it at my own convenience, it came 10min late. Overall expensibe, but the staff are really lovely and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Urban chic, rooftop indulgence!”
Reviews.Author: jamesdawes
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights and cannot recommend highly enough. Impeccable front of house service from the moment we arrived, and throughout our long weekend. Reception staff have superb knowledge of local eateries, bars, shopping areas etc. This is 5 star boutique chic and no mistake. Glass lifts to all floors overlooking the atrium. Champagne on arrival? Thanks very much, we'll take our drinks on the rooftop in incredibly hip surroundings. Follow it up with a mojito you say? Just keep pouring! Try and get a duplex room if you can, they are worth the extra space. The Glass Bar epitomises the clientele of the hotel, so mix it up with the beautiful people if you want. Plenty of Spanish restaurants and bars and Plazas in walking distance so take full advantage. Would certainly go back again. Superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great style”
Reviews.Author: haga888
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Hotel is perfectly located if you like to wander on foot during your vacations. Furthest tourist sight was probably the Royal Palace and that was only a 15-20 min walk. It's rated as a 5-star hotel and I'd say it's realistically a 4 to 4.5 star hotel by North American standards. It had a good design, very unique, but in terms of the ultra luxury that one would expect from a 5-star it just missed the mark by a hair. Bed and pillows were a bit on the hard side. Room was kind of small but I've grown to expect that of european hotels. Also, in this day and age of smartphones, iPads, laptops, etc. I dont think any hotel should be able to call itself 5-star without offering free wi-fi in the rooms. You lose half a star in my books just for that. We had a room on the 4th floor in the back of the hotel facing the side street and it was very quiet. With the super dark blackout curtains it was a deadly combination for sleeping in, which isn't necessarily a bad thing on vacation. If you have an early flight or train to catch make sure you keep the blinds open a crack. Great rooftop bar for a drink before you head out for dinner. They have a pool up there but it's more of a floating pool than swimming pool given it's size. We were debating between Urban and the ME by Melia around the corner and were happy with our choice. The ME is in a very lively square and you'd never get any sleep. Unless that's what you're looking for. All in all it is a very good hotel and if we travelled to Madrid again, we'd definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Urban”
Reviews.Author: Trevor L
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service and great location. However standard rooms although very well decorated are a little small, especially the bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Urban 5 star ?”
Reviews.Author: David P
Reviews.Content: For the extremely high price we paid and a five star grand luxe hotel, the room was disappointingly small and a little bit tired.The bathroom generally was in need of a deep clean or even renewal.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool”
Reviews.Author: dtanpcs
Reviews.Content: This is not a cookie cutter hotel. It has its own distinctive look and style. Great location. The guest rooms are small. The desk is not terribly comfortable for working. But I love the decor, it is not boring. The downstairs bar and rooftop lounge have quite stunning decor.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid”
Reviews.Author: frimz10
Reviews.Content: the Urban is in a great location for sight-seeing - round the corner from Santa Ana and the Plaza de Sol. Quite a funky, cool hotel with a great view of the city from the roof terrace. A very modern downstairs bar is a good place to sit and drink your free champagne. The staff were very helpful and friendly. On the downside, drinks on the terrace, particularly spirits, were pricey and the prices went up in the evenings. The rooms varied in the amount of space available, though the upstairs part was a good idea for husbands who get up before 7. We avoided breakfast and headed for the little breakfast bars nearby or Lhardy's, where you could get a meal at a fraction of the cost at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “September 2011 visit Madrid Urban Hotel”
Reviews.Author: john h
Reviews.Content: We after a few problems with the room had a very nice stay in Madrid the reception staff in particular Virginia were very helpful, however this hotel is not really set up for a tourist holiday and is more directed at Business and the younger generation of people, should you visit i would also suggest that any requirement needed outside the hotel should be booked direct with the provider not via the hotel reception as you will find that they make a 80.00€ charge for each request, we would return again but only use it as a sleeping facility.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as cool as it seems”
Reviews.Author: dublin_boy
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, but doesn't quite match expectations. Our room was lovely, with a really good bed, a good shower and nice toiletries. The roof terrace has great views and is lovely for a sunset apéritif. The location is excellent, a few minutes walk from most attractions. The staff were friendly and helpful However as others have pointed out, the rooftop bar is shockingly expensive - over €10 for a beer. Also much of the pool area is in shadow for a lot of the day so it's not as good for getting some sun as the photos might indicate. WiFi access is limited to an hour a day which is a bit mean for a "trendy" hotel. Breakfast was disappointing with a rather limited range. However fro some reason we weren't charged so all was forgiven!

Reviews.Title: “Good for Business”
Reviews.Author: davicio
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. Lovely and supportive concierge - especially after my altercation with a cab driver charging me 65 Euros from the airport because apparently there are many Hotel Urbans! - don't get caught out. Rooms were beautifully furnished, the view was not great to be honest, but the whole hotel offered a classy business feel. The integral bar to the hotel appears to be a trendy hang out with which they do great bites to eat and swanky drinks. Really friendly staff again - especially as my Spanish is a lot to be desired. Oh - location is pretty perfect as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great roof terrace but poor service”
Reviews.Author: Baron1184
Reviews.Content: great roof terrace with swiming pool, Nice African deco. Junior suite have no natural light, the view inside the building. Service is poor and not friendly except the pool terrace hotel team.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Very helpful staff but very expensive and strange policies on charging drinks!”
Reviews.Author: mazc34
Reviews.Content: I cant fault the staff for their helpfulness and the rooms for being clean & tidy. The pool was a lot smaller than the picture allowed and i was very surprised to find people were getting up early to secure 1 of the 5 beds available. The most shocking was to be charged different prices for drinks by different bars in the hotel. I was advised that this was because it was a 5 star hotel and the glass bar opened to the public at 8pm hence the hefty 5 euro increase. I have never encountered this in a 5 star hotel before especially as a paying guest of that hotel. At the end of the day if you only use this for a hotel then you will have a lovely time but if you eat or drink within the hotel your credit card will take a bashing.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Accomodations With Several Areas Lacking”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCatLady
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel Urban for one night before flying home from Madrid. Overall, the hotel was very nice - very modern, trendy design with actual art in the room, a busy pool scene on the roof (albeit with a very small pool) and a great location walking distance from the Prado and other attractions. The staff was even very helpful in suggesting restaurants, which we found to be a rarity in Spain. The room was pretty large and even had a separate couch and living area. But there are three complaints. First, the wireless internet is only free for one hour. There are computer terminals in the lobby free of charge, but still. Second, the mattresses are very hard, as other reviewers have noted. Third, housekeeping not once, but twice (!), opened the door to our room without knocking! I thought this was not only bizarre, but unacceptable. Overall it was a fine experience, but with the noted downfalls.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: culillo
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, we normally stay at El Emperador as we enjoy the outdoor pool. The Urban had a small outdoor pool just good enough to relax and cool down. The hotel is amazing and we felt really welcome at Reception. We were invited to a glass of champagne on the 6th floor and it was a great experience. This is the hotel to go if you go to Madrid, close to the centre but in a quiet location A perfect stay, we will be back next year

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!!”
Reviews.Author: PTSHFrederiksberg
Reviews.Content: My housband and I have had the pleasure to stay at this hotel more times - and have every time experienced the same excellent and extraordinary friendly service. We do feel very welcome every time. The location of the hotel is perfect - within walking distance of the the big museums, as well as of the gay scenes in Chueca. The interior of the hotel is nicely underdecorated, luxurious. The hotel has a very sophisticated bar with a nice crew. The breakfast is good. Though only 7 years old do many parts of the hotel - the bathrooms first of all, and the nice sun deck around the pool area at the roof terrace need profound renovations and maintenance. The big missing at the hotel is a free WiFi - the hotel has an agreement with an internet supplier that is by far to expensive. All together do we look forward to return to this hotel very soon again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!!”
Reviews.Author: Transient-friend
Reviews.Content: Unbelievably affordable accommodation. We had a loft apartment and it was spacious and neat. We were surprised at the size of the room - it was so spacious!! Location is very central. Lots of cute little restaurants around with great food - japanese, indian, argentinian grill etc and, of course, tapas. Swimming pool upstairs is not one for those who like doing laps, and the gym is hardly worth the time. However the terrace is quite amazing for sun bathing and hanging out. The bar is open most nights till late and on weekends people flock to the terrace bar for the atmosphere. Glass bar on the ground floor has an excellent collection if spirits. Hotel location is ideal. Walking distance from everywhere one would like to be in Madrid. Very helpful staff and great service at bars. Strongly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly despite the trendy exterior”
Reviews.Author: Mum4value
Reviews.Content: The dodgy trendy staff uniforms made my heart sink as we walked through the doorsbut I'm glad to say the staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay. We upgraded to a junior suite at check in and frankly it was the size of a regular room but tastefully decorated and nice extra touches like a jacuzzi bath Didn't know the pope was going tone in town but reception and bell boysreally helpful showing us on maps how to walk to various sites in the city It's central it's peaceful. The roof terrace and pool were a welcome respite from the hot streets. Two thumbs up Urban.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: tulsau
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. I chose this hotel because of the pool/rooftop and boy was it a good choice. The hotel is beautiful and so are the rooms. They are not huge but by European standards--quite roomy. The floor to ceiling window was also great and a joy to wake up to each morning. Be sure to hang out on the roof. It is great and the bar has an entire menu of just gin and tonics. We tried many of them and they were excellent. Location is central and easy walking distance to everything. Staff was attentive and very helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: veerle23
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff, interesting architecture!

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location, Amazing Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: wilreynolds
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Urban for about a week while staying in Madrid, it was simply amazing! The staff was very helpful at all times! What I liked was the location, the ability to walk to the train station, art museum, Plaza Santa Ana, Mayor & Sol - kept me very busy and feeling like I could just walk out my front door and go have a great time! If you are the kind of traveler who likes to just "walk around" and take it all in, but also likes more intimate/small/boutique hotels, then Urban is a great option! The gym is pretty much non existent though...with one small weight rack, a flat bench, and 2 old machines, it is barely going to hold you over, but that is all good!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST of THE BEST MADRID HAS TO OFFER”
Reviews.Author: remoazul
Reviews.Content: The Urban delivers, once again !!! Our seventh consecutive visit. From the moment or arrival, Jose Corredor and his staff go out of their way, literally, to make their guests feel at home. Kudos to the RECEPTION GROUP, including the porters Amadu, JuanMa, Walter and Eugenio!!! The hotel has not lost a step in its eighth year of existence. Location, ambiance, top quality in every aspect. The restaurant staff is SUPERB. The best attitude, and food, even to the late arrivals for breakfast ( We were, each morning !!). The terrace is surely the most vibrant and scenic in all Madrid. One can sit there for hours and just contemplate the city's most emblematic buildings and rooftops. It does not get any better than staying at the Urban while in Madrid. I surely recommend it to everyone. Congratulations to Mr. Felix Garcia, for putting together a winning combination. Will surely return in 2012 !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah2708
Reviews.Content: Hotel urban is in a great location in Madrid with easy access to the Metro and the main city centre. It is avery nice hotel with excellent staff and a lovely pool area in the heat. As with other business hotels i found having to pay for WIFI an issue but the staff were very helpful about this. The staff were also great given that I was a woman on my own, especially in the restaurant and with room service. The rooms are really good, great set up for a working person.

Reviews.Title: “Fantástica localização, serviço arrogante.”
Reviews.Author: RR-Brasil
Reviews.Content: Nao considero um 5 estrelas, mas sim um 4 de alto padrão. Os quartos sao um pouco apertados e o café da manha é caríssimo. Decoração bem moderna, com as ultimas tendências. Lado negativo é o serviço. A impressão que eles passam é que se acham o melhor hotel e nao precisam ser educados.

Reviews.Title: “Urban should be back to #1 in Madrid!!!”
Reviews.Author: adruano
Reviews.Content: After a two week vacation in Spain, we stayed at the best hotels in Barcelona, Segovia, Alicante, Valencia, Sevilla, Granada, and Madrid. This is by far the best hotel experience we had. Rooms are large, perfectly designed, with all the automatic lighting and bathroom fixtures, beds ultra comfortable, linen terrific, LCD HD large screen.... We had the breakfast buffet with was included. Nice buffet with eggs to order. The pool upstairs is small but gorgeous. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only small issue was that one of the elevators was not working. Fortunately we were not there during the most crowded hours (there is a roof top bar which appears to be quite visited).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: D0nTravel
Reviews.Content: When I first visited this hotel it was for dinner at their main restaurant. Sitting at the next table, David Beckham and Posh with a small entourage. This is the level of 'posh' of this hotel. You are greeted by two huge "hollywood style" bouncers (sorry concierges), all dressed up in black and quite menacing but smiling. The lobby bar is a local gem always full with the trendy set and well-to-do. Expensive and small but great for cocktails served with style and a smile. It gets crowded in the evening. The rooms are European chic, smallish for an American audience but very good quality. Prices are in line with a 5 star hotel in Madrid. It is located a stone-throw away from the Spanish Congress, the Pardo Museum, the Thyssen museum and the rest of historical Madrid including la Puerta del Sol and The Royal Palace. You can walk almost anywhere from here. If you are looking for "Hollywood-like" glamour, this is your place. I enjoyed it! Don Travel

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Ridiculous Prices!”
Reviews.Author: JohnMarto
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing, the rooms were gorgeous, all of the facilities were superb. Stylish, modern and very impressive. One of the nicest looking hotels I have stayed in, staff were polite, friendly, all spoke english and there was plenty of staff on hand at all times. The food was amazing, the bars and restaurants stunning. THE PRICES WERE OUTRAGEOUS!!! Two gin and tonics = 31 Euros One bottle of House White = 63 Euros Glass of wine and a bottle of (local) beer = 18 Euros I would stay there again IF THE PRICES WERE REASONABLE. I don't mean cheap, I mean realistic. Even for a 5* hotel the prices were astronomical.

Reviews.Title: “Center of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: fadi13
Reviews.Content: great Hotel, Staff and location They have excellent decorations, clean, friendly staff always helpful. Great food + the glass bar has the best Mojitos in Madrid The hotel location is great, close to the main museums, shopping and restaurants they are all within walking distance and it is lots of fun to walk around one draw back is that with all the modern decorations the hotel does not offer wifi internet compared to the hostel next door will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Chic.”
Reviews.Author: jtmidge
Reviews.Content: I went to Madrid for a quick vacation this winter and had the good fortune of staying at the Urban Hotel. I stayed in one of the hotel's Superior Rooms, and it met all of my requirements. The room was modern, sleek, clean, and surprisingly affordable. One nice touch was the in-room art work, which was a far cry from what you typically see in hotels. It is also worth noting that the front desk was extremely helpful, friendly and competent. The property and staff lived up to the hotel's five star rating in every way. It also doesn't hurt that the hotel is in reasonable walking distance of the Prado and Plaza Mayor. I would certainly stay at the Urban Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Funky”
Reviews.Author: BONOPAROS
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel in Madrid great position. The staff was helpful. The roof bar is nice in the afternoon the pool also looks great. Although it is a little noisy.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 star hotel for a 3 or 4 star price”
Reviews.Author: Frohwein
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked last minute to Spain because we had to cancel our Greece trip due to the rioting. We found the Hotel Urban, which is located in the middle of everything in Madrid. The hotel is absolutely stunning if you like modern design, which we do - we are not into the big, old, stuffy and over done hotels like the Ritz or the Westin Palace, both of which were close to this hotel. The museums are a short walk down the road as is the train station. Such a convenient location! The staff were amazing, friendly, helpful and patient. The rooms were not large, but there was plenty of room to put your stuff away and not feel cluttered. We were originally assigned room 440, which was too close to the elevator but they moved us immediately without a problem or question asked. The hotel, as I said, was magnificently designed with a giant glass atrium - it was really breathtaking. The hotel pool and rooftop area were very, very cool. There was a small pool - emphasize small - but you're on the roof of a cool hotel in the middle of Madrid - I wouldn't have traded it for an olympic sized pool on the ground. There's also a rooftop bar and restaurant to further the atmosphere. My wife and I highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “More style than substance”
Reviews.Author: FlixynTed
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel celebrating a birthday. Can't help but feeling ripped off.... The hotel is very stylish with lots of ethnic statues and art dotted about the place. First impressions are good , but for a hotel that is classed as a 'five star grand luxe' @ ~€200 night it doesn't fulfil its initial promise. The rooms are small and very dark , as everything is designed with dark wood and dark furnishings and furtniture. The airconditioning in the room was totally inadequate and we actually thought it was broken , but was told ' it's as good as it gets'! On a positive note - it was very quiet. The pool on the roof is described as an infinity pool - no chance - it is a tiny dipping pool. With some exception , staff were generally friendly - particularly in reception - but often a bit hapless and definitely not as slick as you would expect at a hotel of this rank. It seems that all guest are offered a voucher of a free glass of Champagne in the Glass bar in the hotel lobby - nice gesture but shame about the staff in the bar. They must have felt they were too cool to talk to their customers as they barley acknowledged us. I have stayed in different hotels in Madrid for business and pleasure and would definitely not come back to the Urban. You can get great , stylish hotels at a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Artistic Hotel in Art Museum District”
Reviews.Author: Lexvettegirl
Reviews.Content: We were finishing our trip to Spain in Madrid and wanted to splurge on our lodging. The Urban did not disappoint. We booked the two level duplex room which contained all the amenities we could want. In fact, we didn't feel a bit guilty about spending a lot of time in our room instead of exploring Madrid. Great way to complete the vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious chic withouth service”
Reviews.Author: robertSaltLakeCity
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed six nights total (3 on each side of side trips). Great location but trying hard to be chic without the class. Service was lackadaisical. Questions about recommendations, side trips, shopping were answered without much context or helpful hints. More a pervasive sense of ennui. Room was OK, but dark. You only received 60 mins free Wifi daily and had to pay for more. The bar was outrageously expensive--6 euros for a small coke, 17 for a screwdriver. Would look for an alternative next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel. I will be checking out other Urban Hotels in future.”
Reviews.Author: Omar78
Reviews.Content: I spent forever picking a hotel in Madrid for a weekend with my girlfriend. That involved me trawling hundreds of reviews for the "perfect hotel". Predictably, there is no such thing. Even the best hotels in Madrid get some angry 1 star reviews: people complaining about small beds, noise, rude staff, expensive breakfast. You name it, I read it. The same applies to Hotel Urban. However I decided the Hotel scored very well considering the hundreds of reviews submitted for it. The stats proved me more than right. The hotel is beautiful to look at, from the outside and inside. A gorgeous meeting of stone, glass and steel facades, other hotels in Madrid look cheap or stuffy in comparison. The rooms are beautifully designed and I cannot fathom some of the complaints I read about bathroom and room being too small. Our room was huge and our bathroom had two sinks, a glass panel shower and a separate bath tub. The bed was so comfortable we intend to write to the hotel to find out where they buy their mattreses. I fell asleep in seconds, something I never do at home. The rooftop bar and pool is a stunner; and a quick drink or two was a lovely way to spend the evening before heading out on the town. The roof bar gets visitors in its own right and we often popped our heads in at 2 am to find the roof packed with people who were a little too shi-shi for their own good. But then, a glamorous hotel is bound to attracts a dolled-up crowd. Soak it up and enjoy the glitz. Our room was on the floor directly under the roof bar, yet the noise we heard when it was busiest, was still minimal and would only affect the lightest of sleepers. If you pick a lower floor (i..e. anything below fifth floor) you can avoid the risk alogether, but I had no problem at all. In terms of location, the hotel is close to St Ana Square, the Prado, and walking distance to lots of tapas bars close by, and if you can walk for 20 mins you can go to some of the trendier night spots like Chueca and La Latina. This also means you could get the room without breakfast, which seemed a little pricey. We found lots of alternatives close by. We had a wonderful time in Madrid, and the Hotel Urban was an important factor in why we enjoyed it so much. If you want to go five stars and need a pool, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly noisy, freezing pool”
Reviews.Author: Travelerldr
Reviews.Content: It is a lovely interior bordering on tacky when you see the plastic faux-snake table covers. The last 3 nights however have been filled with the incredible noise of the protests outside that have begun each night at midnight and lasted well past 3 am. Tonight, there is a party in the atrium for 30 + people and the noise is keeping my family from sleeping. It is 10:15 and has not ended. Completely unacceptable. We had planned to stay at the Ritz but chose the Urban because we have two kids and there is a pool here, but the pool is FREEZING. My kids who regularly swim in 68 degree F water will not get in it. Our advice... Stay at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Overall just average”
Reviews.Author: JoyTravel74
Reviews.Content: We booked a Duplex Suite because of the recommendation in the Wallpaper Travel Guide. Travelling with a baby of five months we can not recommend the hotel. The rooms and the bathrooms are very tiny (the very small double bed is never 5*-Standard!) and the whole stay we didn't feel to be welcomed, so we never felt at home. We did like the design of the hotel and its perfect situation close to the park and the Prado Museum. The pool on the upper deck looks cool, the gym is a tiny, damp and bad-smelling room with two machines - a pity for a hotel playing in the Champions League. Overall it was just average, no exciting moment or any positive, surprising aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: BourneTravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Urban during May 2011 for 4 nights. The hotel is in an EXCELLENT location. It is so close to Puerto Del Sol and Gran Via and the train station Sol. In addition to this, most of the main museums in Madrid are within walking distance of this hotel. The hotel staff were ok (we had one bad experience with a front desk agent) and the housekeeping staff were even more friendly. The rooms are a comfortable size for 2 and bathroom is nicely decorated. The rooftop bar is far over rated we actually much preferred the Glass Bar located in the lobby. A nice added bonus was that the hotel gave us 2 complimentary glasses of champagne when we checked in! The little things go a loooooooooooonnnnnnnggggggg way. Highly recommended hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: gb7547
Reviews.Content: Dined in this hotel once before and had to go back to stay there! the room lived up to my expectations, it was the perfect stay. Thank you very much Urban hotel, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: PandM0
Reviews.Content: A terrific, quiet, contemporary hotel in a great location. The rooms are small, but very well designed so everything fits perfectly. Although spendy, the breakfast buffet is awesome. The corridors are a joy to walk through—beautifully lit and decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping on hard surface”
Reviews.Author: Ruchi1009
Reviews.Content: Although the location is excellent without a doubt, we could not sleep because the bed was like sleeping on a dinning table. The front desk staff is not friendly either. Everything was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjireland090
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in Urban hotel with 6 year old boy. Stayed in Junior suite which had sofa bed. Room was spacious. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Outdoor roof top swimming pool (water was very cold). Taxi from airport costs approx 35 euros. The location is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: billynicol
Reviews.Content: We experienced the warmest welcome at the Urban. The staff were very friendly and could not do enough for us. The hotel is very atmospheric and has beautiful decor throughout. particularly we liked the roof top terrace and the views around Madrid. The Duplex room was roomy and clean - we would have given five stars had it not been for a broken window blind on the skylight window and the shower tap came off in my hand. These are very minor grumbles and I am being very picky. The sleep quality was also a little affected by the heat in the room. We tried the air conditioning but it didn't seem to cool things very quickly. The value was good for the room rate, but at around 14 Euros for a beer and 9 Euros for a Coke on the terrance, it seemed a little overpriced. The pool on the rooftop was beautiful but too cold to swim in in May. Other than that all in all a wonderful stay and would recommend to anyone. Thanks Urban Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in great area of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: LAAnonymous
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a fantastic experience at Hotel Urban... There were a few minor drawbacks worth mentioning, but we'd stay there again and would recommend it to other travelers. On the plus side, we got a package deal that included the Madrid cultural card (which permits access to many museums during a 24-hour period (of course, it's very hard to really get its full value unless you are extremely committed to doing so). The package also included breakfast, which was fantastic selection and service and normally would cost 20+ euros per person/per day. The room was nice. Not terribly spacious, but well designed, with a desk and small couch for relaxing. We really like the overall aesthetic. The front desk staff couldn't be nicer... Upon check in, they gave us a hand-written voucher good for two glasses of Champagne at one of their two bars, and also gave us a lot of recommendations/local information. As for the cons, they were minor, but should be mentioned. The hotel charges for WiFi but gives connected Internet away for free (in theory). The staff was really helpful and provided the proper cords so we could access the free Internet but the service didn't work in the room or in the lobby. regardless of how many cords we tried. However, they have a free business center with two Macs and so checking email was quite easy even without having access in the room. They also provided a one-time 24-hour internet password so we could access WiFi at no cost (after we told them the room connection wasn't working). I also have to mention that though the bathroom is very aesthetically pleasing and the toiletries were really high quality, both the tub and the sink had slowish drains. We ended up unscrewing the drain cap in the tub and it worked well after that, but the sink was very sluggish. We ended not wanting to work out, but partially that was because the "gym" was miniscule -- I think it was just a bench with weights, elliptical and bike, or very similar. The room was super small, but did have a TV and water, as I recall. The only other problem we ran into was when we went to the rooftop bar to redeem our Champagne voucher. The bartender working at the time spoke almost no English and didn't seem familiar with the voucher, so we ended up paying for those two drinks. However, the next night we went down to the main bar off the lobby and they couldn't have been nicer. They served us quality Champagne and offered a little snack at no cost to us. Overall, it was a pleasant experience and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “really great stay Heather from Beverley East Yorkshire”
Reviews.Author: Heather190813
Reviews.Content: Stayed for our sons 21st birthday, with our son and his partner. The hotel is in a great location, although the road is very busy. The hotel staff were really friendly, The hotel is very well priced, usually stay at The Ritz but will stay here again. Had a drink in the bar which was really really nice, Lots of nice places to eat right near the hotel. Just a word of warning watch the metro, there are lots of pick pockets around, they follow you onto the tube and stand next to you on the train (they usually work in two) they are usually women, Go on the open top bus tour its really good.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Nick4u
Reviews.Content: Decided to try out the Urban after many visits to Madrid. The hotel looks trendy and has a cool vibe from the street and the lobby. It also has a rooftop pool which we had seen on a previous visit. This hotel catches your eye. Our room was ready in advance which was appreciated. We stayed in a standard room on the 4th floor. The room was very small. The bathroom was modern but the placement of the sink partially blocked the entrance to the room. This was a hassle in the middle of the night. The hallways were marble which was very attractive but noisy in the morning. Half the time one elevator was not working. The pool had a rooftop bar which had great views but very overpriced. With all the great restaurants in the area we did not eat at the Urban. The location is very close to Sol, the Prado and Retiro park. There was free WIFI in the room for one hour a day but the service asked for your passport number which I did not think was necessary. There was a gym but it contained two machines and was more of an afterthought. The bed was firm and aside from the footsteps on the marble we slept well. I am glad we had a chance to stay at the Urban and I would recommend it for one night just to check it out. I liked it better as a place for a drink than for a place to spend the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff; Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: novaezm
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Urban because it was centrally located and priced within reason of other similar boutique hotels in the area. We found the staff to be very helpful; before we arrived, the hotel sent an email offering to set up airport transfers. We had them set up our airport transfer since we arrived so early in the morning, which was great. And luckily our room was ready when we arrived at 9am. Our room was pretty small and the bathroom was tight, but the room was quiet (we had no noise issues at all and we were there for the weekend: Fri, Sat & Sun nites) The dark-out shades definitely made it very easy to sleep. There was no clock in the room, so bring an alarm if you want to get up early (we missed El Rasto on Sunday because we overslept!) We did not eat at the hotel restaurant since there were so many great places around the area. The staff helped us with recommendations and reservations; they recommended the Flamenco at the Casa Patas, which was AMAZING! The location could not have been better. We walked everywhere (the Prado, Plaza Mayor, Palacio Real, etc) and found we were never too far from our Hotel. We loved our time in Madrid and the Hotel Urban helped make it special.

Reviews.Title: “Cool boutique hotel well located”
Reviews.Author: Martynjw
Reviews.Content: Great location in this cool stylish boutique hotel. Rooms are spacious and funky whilst the 'museum' is different. Staff are ok could try harder. Cool bar in the lobby is a place to be seen but on the pricey side. Restaurant is above average, but try's too hard. Strongly recommend when you book insist on a room NOT on the street side as it can be very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: soundguyo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Urban during the Semana Santa week in Spain; when we checked in they told us the hotel was fully booked. My wife & I liked the very central location and the bathroom which featured a soaking tub + a large separate shower. The room itself couldn't be called spacious, but was by no means claustrophobic, and the firm bed was comfortable. The location was tops; we walked to all the museums & sites and the nearby Metro station for other journeys. The nearby Santa Ana square area was filled with tapas bars & restaurants. Unlike some of the other reviewers we found the staff to be very helpful. My only sour experience during our stay was the bill at the (very nice) rooftop bar for 2 x Mojtos: over 32 Euros! They were very tasty, but wow...

Reviews.Title: “A place where i feel like at home!!”
Reviews.Author: ASMITH_11
Reviews.Content: Since the first time i stayed in this boutique hotel i felt like i was at home, the rooms are not the biggest but cozy, stylist and comfortable and they have the pillows that im always looking for when i travel around. But what really make me feel here like at home is the staff, they are realible and always with a smile trying to satisfy my needs whateverer they are. That is why this place will be allways my home in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: ““A really good experience””
Reviews.Author: house0077
Reviews.Content: For my first visit I wanted a very central location hotel in Madrid , so I booked at the Urban Hotel. The room was very modern and with a nice welcome gift. Very impressive the art pieces inside¡ I ordered some drinks for having a good time in the terrace, and views were fantastic, better at dusk, and there are a lot of cocktails to choose. The concierge was very helpful for some tickets I needed to buy. For sure I will try to come back to Madrid and to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Total Disapointment”
Reviews.Author: docoliver
Reviews.Content: I thought that other reviewers were skeptic, but this hotel still need a lot to grow because not all 5 star hotels are the same. The front desk staff was very cold in its welcome, not with the usual attentions that you get from a true 5 star. The room was rather small, dark, dated and faced a window to nowhere. I immediately looked at the leading hotels of the world site and switched to Gran Melia Fenix which although is a 5 star is truly in an entirely different league of its own. When I informed the front desk staff that I was leaving, they returned the deposit minus one night which is in the contract. Not a problem because those were the terms that I signed for; however, the front desk man seemed to be more worried about his bosses in Barcelona than about customer satisfaction. I must say that I have had the same situation in other 5 star hotels, and they have voluntarily returned my deposit, no questions asked, even against what is said in the contract, when that happens, you realize good faith on behalf of a company. To summarize, do not choose this hotel if you are used to real 5 stars like Trumph International, Palazzo Versace, Gran Melia Fenix in Madrid, Principe di Savoia in Milan or Pestana Palace in Lisbon. All these hotels I mentioned have something in common, they are leading hotels, perhaps a sub-category withing the five star range. The sad part, is that some of these true leading hotels are less expensive and with a service far beyond what you will get at Urban GL, Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobic”
Reviews.Author: sti5brigade
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as my boss was - we were on a business trip. I've stayed in many hotels in Madrid over the years and generally the quality is poor for a European City Room was very small, opposite the lifts they must have the smallest rooms - I would certainly hope that there arent smaller rooms! Bed too hard and toilets just like a closet Price was high I thought at 225 Euro's a night, though it did include Breakfast, which was also a very simple affair though if you werent in a hurry I think you could order some separate food. I found a hair on my fruit.. and it wasnt mine! They do try hard, with a free glass of champagne in the evening and I had a 0.5litre free bottle of wine in the room, promoting a vineyard/or was it a restaurant.. I didnt care, which I gave to a work colleague as I travel with hand luggage so couldnt take it back with me Sadly these things dont make up for an overpriced and uncomfortable stay and I wont be returning

Reviews.Title: “Cool design, great location, unfriendly stuff. Not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: dBogda
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a very central location, basically across the steet from Parliament, and just around the corner from Prado and Thyssen museums. The central town square Sol is also couple of minutes away. It is almost ideal for exploring Madrid. I tend to prefer modern hotels, with interesting design, though very often they turn up to be very unpractical and too cold. However, this cannot be said about Hotel Urban. Iwas actually quite pleasantly surprised by hotel's deisgn. It really is a beautiful hotel, which does feel warm and very pleasant to be in. I honestly loved and enjiyed the whole design concept. However, the main problem I found is that this design and hotel is either poorly maintained or in serious need of refreshing. Parquet floor was scratched, so were the walls, bathroom ceiling panels were misaligned and a bit rusty. The wall behind curtains seems never to have been painted at all. Although, these are serious misgivings it was not as bad as it might sound. But certainly had a serious imapct on the overall impression. Overall my room was certainly too small for a 5 star hotel (I was staying in a standard room). I found it to be quite OK, however it is definitely not up to a standard one associates with hotels of this category. It was a bit dark, which was not an issue for me, but the soundproofing was far from ideal. One could easily hear the noise coming from the street (Madrid is quite a noisy town, very late into the night). Staff was very cold and unwelcoming. Overall service is far below standards of 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern hotel at great location”
Reviews.Author: Globesailor
Reviews.Content: If you like an extra modern hotel which gathers younger crowds, this is the place to be. The suite I had was great (if a bit pricey), both in terms of space and decor. Bathroom was modern but also utilitarian. My room was facing the attrium so there was a bit of a buzz going through the soundproofing at peak hours (20:00-22:00). I do not consider it a big deal though, since this was not really annoying and definetely not at a time when somebody would go to sleep. The Glass Bar at the entrance of the hotel is very popular with clients and visitors alike. I didn't have breakfast or dinner there, so I cannot rate the restaurant. Location is great for a Saturday night out, midway between the Prado and Puerta del Sol and quite close to Plaza de Mayor. This is a place I would recommend if you want to pay something extra for a top modern hotel at a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: tageo
Reviews.Content: Our room was great, 2 floors. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The reception staff suggested a great restaurant. The cleaning lady gave us extra towels and kept the room spotless. The doorman was always there to greet us and loaded all of our bags upon departure. What more can I say, they treated us like royalty. Plus, it's in a fantastic location near all the action and museums, in the center of Madrid. With so many hotels to choose from, we made the right choice.

Reviews.Title: “So cool”
Reviews.Author: ThamyresVM
Reviews.Content: Very hightech hotel, beautifuly designed. Great location and a very trendy bar downstairs. The rooms are great, spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: REattorney
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 kids ages 9 and 5 just spent 7 nights at the Urban. We arrived at 10am and had booked a jr. suite with a connecting room. When we first arrived in the lobby no one was there to greet us, i thought this was odd. We navigated our way to the check in desk and stood there for at least a minute before someone greeted us and asked us for our credit card. I gave my card to the the person at the desk who dissapeared into a small room behind the desk. A few minutes later he appeared and stated one of our rooms was ready. We were ok with that as we had arrived early and check in was later in the day. The rooms, both the suite and the double room were nicely decorated. The bathrooms were also very nice. The beds were comfortable. There are 2 issues that i had with the rooms: 1. There are no alarm clocks or any other clocks that display the time in the rooms and 2. The rooms are very noisey. Our rooms were on the 3rd floor and we could hear the traffic outside. Traffic on the street outside the hotel is very heavy at all hours of the day and night. As a result of these two issues i would give this hotel 4 stars instead of 5. The Glass bar is very chic and a great place to just hang out. The restaraunt is also very nice and service is great. The hotel's location is very central to all the sites. You can walk alomost anywhere. The Parado is a 5 min walk. All in all we enjoyed our stay but probably not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Urban Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kingdaveone
Reviews.Content: Madrid: Beatiful, clean city with thingds to do and see...Restaurants, bars are great, good night clubs... Pro : Good location Cons : Room are very very dark (you need to use electricity all the time) and small (I had a suite) Room on the big avenue are noisy Service is not good The first look you think the decoration is nice but then you realize it is poorly done Swimming pool on the top with the bar: it's a joke ! It feels cheap

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near the Prado”
Reviews.Author: teejay86
Reviews.Content: The only reason I can't rank this hotel higher is the noise within and outside the hotel that started very early in the morning. The lobby, restaurant and bar are attractive and the hotel is a two minute walk from the Prado and several museums. This is a taxi or bus ride away from the old town and Plaza Mayor, however. The concierge booked us amazing seats at a Flamenco show at the last moment. www.teethetrav.travellerspoint.com

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gusanovich
Reviews.Content: Very clean, excellent staff, good location, close to museums and good restaurants

Reviews.Title: “nice, but not 5 star deluxe”
Reviews.Author: pot28
Reviews.Content: I had great expectations for a 5 star deluxe hotel, but after staying there I would drop at the very least the deluxe bit. Although the hotel is very nice, great design and look, fantastic location and great food.........for a 5 start deluxe I would expect not to hear other people in the hall while I was sleeping. I assume is that the doors are not as thick as needed. I did not hear my next door guest, but I did hear very well when other were entering their rooms in my hall. I would certainly expect a really nice branded toiletries which by the way you get on any 4 star hotel. There were average Derby hotels brand toiletries nothing deluxe about it and I believe this is an absolute must when you are a 5 star hotel. I would have been more impress with nice toiletries and less marble in the bathroom. Regarding the cleaning service: My room had my bed done, but it was not tidy......1st time ever that this happens to me and I travel often. positive side: Location and service were fantastic and the bed was very comfortable and so were the sheets. Service will make you feel welcome and they were very helpful. Size of my room was great too. Bar was very trendy and had a good vibe. Overall, it is a good hotel and very trendy, but If I pay deluxe I expect to be given deluxe.

Reviews.Title: “Very Chic”
Reviews.Author: patrick621
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Urban, we had asked for an upgrade but on arrival this wasnt available,however we did get 2 free glasses of champagne.The hotel is perfectly situated to explore Madrid on foot.Rooms are very contemporary and essential for Madrid well soundproofed..We will return

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, good service”
Reviews.Author: luxehip
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights, checked in at 7am - no problem. they were completely booked so we didn't get our suite upgrade, and no counter free-breakfast offer though. They have valet parking for EUR 25 which is a little cheaper than public parking. Friendly staff, good service. Walking distance to the heart of Madrid and Metro station. Neighborhood is safe, and we are facing a small street so the sleep was quite quiet, except the thin wall, we could hear people talking and cleaning in the morning. if you stay away from the elevator, it gets quieter. the deor was very interesting, and there is a tiny museum in the basement which opens 24/7. there is a gym and an outdoor swimming. Overall great value! but it would be nice if they could offer free breakfast in exchange for not able to upgrade us to the suite. and they need some better sound proof since you could hear quite a lot of things going on.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Nathalie D
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of major sites. The hotel is very stylish with modern rooms with all amenities. The only negative comment I would have is concerning breakfast, which was too expensive for the limited choice.

Reviews.Title: “Urban has the wow factor”
Reviews.Author: spiceylulu
Reviews.Content: Fantastic cool hotel with a brilliant bar and comfortable room

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel77079
Reviews.Content: We loved the Urban! Located halfway between the Prado and Plaza Mayor, it was central to everything we wanted to do. Reception was very accommodating with suggestions and directions. We had dinner in the restaurant and it was fabulous! The Glass Bar downstairs is always active - if not a little smoky. The only drawback was that nighttime was loud. You could hear revelers all night long and the garbage trucks woke us every morning at 4am. But I think goes along with big city living.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel- great breakfast- quiet- super location!”
Reviews.Author: Bristow2008
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Madrid. We stayed at Urban Hotel for two nights. The hotel and staff are wonderful. Delicious, full breakfast! We were celebrating a birthday and within minutes of check-in...a knock at the door was followed by a yummy brownie dessert with a lit candle! Nice touch. The rooms are a good size, bathrooms lovely. Bathrobes and slippers! We made a switch this trip from Roomate Alicia and we are glad we did!

Reviews.Title: “all style no substance”
Reviews.Author: RegularTraveler_10
Reviews.Content: Urban is not worth it's 5 star rating. Lobby looks good and restauarnt + bar food is OK, but following issues with room: 1. no natural light, v small window 2. ordered bottle of cava and chocolates to be in room pre-arrival since this was romantic stay, this was not done by hotel mgt / staff despite email confirmation a few days before. 3. tv didn't work - no english channels, fuzzy pictures. took 2 days to fix, after obnoxious comments from hotel mgt about how "tv is not important for this hotel anyway". 4. room design bad - no hooks in bathroom, no full length mirror. 5. heat wasn't working during unsual cold spell in madrid (0 degrees and freezing in the room). 6. unhelpful staff to resolve all the above issues. i would highly recommend that you do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and tastefully designed hotel however rather noisy and lacking individual service.”
Reviews.Author: MeMartin
Reviews.Content: Very attractive, modern and funky hotel. Great location just 2 minutes if metro Sevilla. Great quality rooms with individual designer touch.
