Downside: noisy, we stayed on the 1st floor but off the little road and not the main road and still very noisy, could hear everything from emptying bins in the morning to a crying child in a room above us. I specifically requested a quiet room. This was my only request. Staff at the Glass Bar was not particularly bothered about delivering good individual service, not much effort done there. Although the bar itself is great and funky. Not sure I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great city, great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Antoine_Saint
Reviews.Content: It was a true pleasure to find such a charming hotel in such a hot location in madrid. It is only a short walking distance from the main shops in Velasquez and from the cibeles square. Great Vibe and good looking people fill the lobby bar with its modern design. als the rooftop area is nice although it was already too cold to be out confortabbly. I recommend it to anyone staying in madrid, either with friends or colleague or with a romantic company.

Reviews.Title: “a cool hotel that's hot!”
Reviews.Author: francesca-b
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a romantic location in Madrid that is stylish and modern, look no further than the Hotel Urban which seems to ooze sex appeal from every piece of wood, slate, marble and leather. We pushed the boat out and booked a suite which was well worth the extra expense: it was roomy with a leather sofa, glass table and chairs and a fabulous bathroom including a huge jacuzzi bath sitting in a picture window (thankfully with push-button controlled blinds). It's not often you can find a solution to bringing children along yet retaining your own privacy. Our suite had an interconnecting standard room for our teenage son which proved a big hit with him. Too often hotels don't consider families who want to be together yet where parents want a bit of space for themselves. The Urban ticks all the boxes. I could tell you about the delicious breakfasts, the trendy Glass Bar, the fantastic location and the excellent service but other reviewers will do that for you. All I need to say is this hotel is hot, hot, hot!

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Spanish!”
Reviews.Author: BLUjaguar
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff greeted us on arrival and check in was efficient. The room was not large but in fairness was what we had expected and was clean and in good condition. The bed was comfortable and there was a small sofa and coffee table in the room. The bathroom was well equiped with a good shower and good bathrobes. We stayed for a long weekend for our first time in Madrid - it was a great - lots of culture and great eating! The hotel is well located and although its not right in the heart of the old city, walking to all the main sights and museums is easy and enjoyable through the traditional narrow streets. We loved the cocktails in the bar and the late night atmosphere was both local and buzzing. Not too much to complain about but the rooms could be a little larger for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “I was very happy here”
Reviews.Author: dkrubes
Reviews.Content: We were there for 5 nights visiting my kids studying from the USA. I reserved a duplex figuring that it was more sq ft so we'd have more space. The set up is weird and dangerous. Steps are slippery and the sleeping area downstairs is small and tight. The upstairs works on the same lighting so expecting my wife or I could go upstairs should we awake earlier did not work, cause to turn on any lights, lit up them whole place. We management was terrific, they moved us to a standard room, and adjusted or price downward, and gave us free breakfast for the 5 days. BTW, the breakfast is nice, but had it not been free, it's not worth it. Javier at the desk in the afternoons is awesome! Speaks great English and very helpful with food and logistics. The hotel is sneaky with respect to wireless, it's not free, and you can't get it because kubi can not send the codes to USA cell phones. So the front desk gives you a card, you think it's free for the hassle, but then they hit for 12 euros....sneaky. In this day and age , when you are dropping $1500 dollars for your hotel, you shouldn't pay for wireless. Rooftop bar is nice. Rooms are clean. Doormen are wonderful. Ladies at front desk are all stand offish, men are nice. Location is great. Easy walk to Sol. Pickpockets everywhere. Some great local bars and clubs in walking distance. Santa Ana sq is great. We ate in the sqnat a tapasmbar called Lateral it was very chic and great food. Easy walk to the Prada, the gardens there are worth the 2.5 euro. Did a day trip to Toledo. book your trains like Renfe at El Corte de Inglis, it's easier than doing it at the station. Metro is the way to get around. For great meals, El Paragues! Great tapas , find tximimiri, for a fun lunch the Boqueria de San Miguel is worth the trip. Don't leave Spain without shopping at Zara and Massimo Dutti...great stuff at great prices. Always ask for a VAT receipt when shopping, then find the VAT exchange at the airport and get back about 10 percent in cash. They won't give u those receipts unless you ask. Leave 3 hours at the airport in Madrid between immigration, baggage, VAT and the long distance between the terminals. Adios and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Urban Class”
Reviews.Author: Carmelites
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Urban Hotel, managed and owned by the Derby Hotel Company, for three nights--our first nights in Spain (Madrid). Ideally located in the museum triangle (Prado, Reina Sofia, and Thyssen-Bornemicza), this hotel is gorgeous--tastefully decorated with authentic Asian antiques (mostly Buddhist) in each room and with a beautiful glass bathroom with lavish stainless steel fixtures, the kind that are very expensive in the US. (We had a junior suite, an upgrade from the deluxe room we had reserved.) The room was very spacious, minimalist in red tones and white, with wooden tansu and built-in wardrobe, and impeccably designed lighting. I would have liked small museum-quality lights in the glass cases displaying the art, to focus on their beauty. Everything about this hotel is to be recommended: the beautiful common space in the lobby (with Pacific Island --Oceania-- decor), the rooftop bar with a great shaved foie gras appetizer, the complimentary champagne, chocolates, and drinking water, and the small art museum on the lower floor. The room could also be darkened at night (with very heavy curtains) with windows facing a central courtyard to eliminate street noise. We were unable to eat at their renowned restaurant Europa Deco, which has been featured in a range of culinary magazines and cookbooks, due to our tight schedule. The only recommendation I would make is to have a more responsive email system. We tried to ask questions before departure by email but did not receive any responses, except the confirmation of our reservation. This worried us, since we had questions about the museum pass and restaurants, but on arrival the concierge staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Chic”
Reviews.Author: asora10066
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modern, very clean and in a great location. The rooftop bar offers an awesome view of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Chic & Classy - definately worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Louie1401
Reviews.Content: The Urban is a very chic, classy hotel. We enjoyed our stay here for 4 nights. Initial impression of the reception/lobby area is excellent with the porter being extremely efficient in helping with luggage. We had booked a duplex room which wasn't ready on arrival & we were told to come back later in the afternoon. On arriving back at the hotel later on, the duplex room still wasn't ready so we were offered to view a standard room instead. We had a look at both the options & decided that the duplex was really no better than the standard room - it's just a room that's split into an upstairs area - those stairs could be tricky after a few drinks! Or a pain unpacking your bags. We took the standard room at a reduced rate to the duplex & were perfectly happy with it. The only gripe we had was that the wardrobe was a nightmare for anyone trying to unpack/get to the other side of the bed as it is a sliding concertina type wardrobe that opens out into the room blocking the way to the far side of the bed and window & is pretty horrendous to move the door about. You just end up crawling across the bed! We had welcome drinks for us in the upstairs trendy rooftop bar with the swimming pool. It was a faboulous view up there & the pink champagne was very welcome! The service in the hotel is spot on with the reception staff being very helpful in giving us excellent restaurant recommendations. The waiter staff in the Glass Bar are also very efficient. The Glass Bar is a great spot to have a nice drink (although very expensive but hey this is Madrid!), the little snacks they bring with the drinks are delicious! Nice touch with the chocolates & bottle of water brought to your room on the first evening are also really good. The rooftop bar/pool is a lovely part of the hotel - a chance to escape the busy city & chill out in the sun. Although small, the swimming pool is perfect for a quick cool down. We were there in their ‘winter season’ so on our last say were were on our own and so felt like our own private pool area!! Would highly recommend this hotel in Madrid & would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CADream1n
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings on the Urban Hotel. The location was outstanding and I really liked the modern look of the hotel. The doormen were very helpful and courteous, but the girl behind the reception desk was not very helpful. We found the rooms to be very clean and although I also found it a little strange that the bed was downstairs and the living room upstairs, but I can't imagine negotiating the stairs in the middle of the night if I needed to use the restroom and some people may not want to use the living area so I guess it make sense. What I did think was funny was that the channels on the TV upstairs didn't match the channels on the TV downstairs. The beds were very comfortable and they provided a free bottle of water and a glass of champaign on our first day. There is WiFi in the hotel, but you have to pay for it. This was the only hotel in Spain we stayed in that didn't have free WiFi, but I am guessing that is driven by being in Madrid vs the hotel. There were two PCs available in the business center for free and they were not difficult to get on. The bar is also hopping! We came home at 1:30 am on a Wednesday night and it look like they were just getting started.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but noisy hotel - good spot in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Joris79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a perfect spot in Madrid, near Sol. Near metrostations Sol and Sevilla (5 min walk). It has a beautiful entrance and rooms, although the rooms are a bit smaller then you may expect for this budget. Check the Egyptian 'museum' in the basement; really nice! The rooms on the roadside are way too noisy, especially on Saturday nights when all the Madrilenos are partying (and they will do that also under your hotelroom). The staff is friendly but not overwhelming. You can see that this hotel is in the "big budget league". When we asked for tickets for the Real Madrid game on Sunday, they told us that they could arrange these but for a higher price then normal. They sorted out what this price was and came back with a incredible price of EUR 180 PER TICKET! Finally we bought the tickets at the counter at the stadion, and we paid only EUR 60 per ticket. The difference is too big. It is a beautiful hotel but a little bit overpriced and too noisy for a hotel in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KiwiTravler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location,great service,walking distance to some fantastic live jazz bars. Stayed for 4 days and only criticism was the TV reception was bad,complained to reception but this was never repaired over 4 days!!

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Modern”
Reviews.Author: LeeLee3006
Reviews.Content: Urban Hotel in Madrid rates number one for location and service. The standard rooms are a bit small but very sleek. Service was excellent from the start. We had a problem with our room (the sink was leaking), so we were moved to an upgraded room, and there was a chilled bottle of cava waiting in the room for us. The hotel is an a great central location, but the only problem here is that it can be a bit noisy - which is to be expected in a city. The terrace bar and swimming pool are great for chilling out after a day walking around the city. And the glass bar is very impressive. The gym was a very small (no treadmill) but adequate. The hotel isnt cheap but its definately worth it!

Reviews.Title: “September trip”
Reviews.Author: Lollymack
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, great ambience. Great staff, friendly and helpful. I would definately visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Surprise - Four Star Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Mouse58
Reviews.Content: The room was normal for Europe. The lighting a bit wierd to control (No desk lamp) but everything was really modern and quite classy. Our room faced the street and it was really quiet. They invested well in the windows. The computers in the lobby were difficult to operate (Apples on glass tables). The front desk staff tried to please in every way. We were really impressed by their marketing measures - we received a free bottle of wine from the company's vineyard and an invitation to receive another if we tried the hotel restaurant. It was the best hotel restaurant we ever ate at. From the gazpacho to the cheese plate it was perfect. The location is central to the Plazo Mayor and the Prado Museum - check it out

Reviews.Title: “Cool urban chic”
Reviews.Author: Xanadustar
Reviews.Content: We had a duplex room and got a relatively good deal from Design Hotels (guaranteed upgrade and inclusive breakfast, which I couldn't find on any other website). The room was lovely - all dark wood, chrome and a marble bathroom, and the upstairs area had a comfortable leather sofa and TV. To be honest, we didn't really use the upper part of the room but it looked very cool and was nice to have the extra space. There was even a work of indiginous art for us to admire! Staff friendly and helpful and all spoke good English. Beware, if you like two extra pillows on the bed they are available in the room but are hidden in the drawer under the bed when they do turn down - look for them there before you call the concierge as I did! I really wanted a hotel with a pool in Madrid but we didn't use it at all, too busy out and about seeing the sights and I was a bit put off by other comments saying it was packed - as others have said there is not a lot of room for lounging on the terrace but it did look very inviting. I didn't find outside noise a problem at all, the windows are double glazed and if closed you can't hear any noise from the street. Air conditioning worked very well. Breakfast was fine - a choice of continental buffet style and eggs etc cooked to order. My husband really rated the coffee. All in all I thought Urban was a fantastic place to stay. The building is a great mix of old and very modern and it's within easy reach of all the major sites. On the expensive side but not too painful if you can get a good deal. Oh, and complimentary glass of champagne on the terrace and half bottle of wine in the room. Nice touches!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Victoria5
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay here with my family in August. Positives: Centrally located and within walking distance to all major attractions Quiet rooms even though they face a main street Connecting rooms which is a big plus for families Lots of extras included -- free business center in lobby, champagne at the rooftop bar, wine in room and fresh coffee and tea delivered to your room in the morning Great rooftop bar/pool area to cool off during the day, albeit small Negatives: Rooms are on the small side, even the suites Faint smell of smoke in the room Signature restaurant is closed in August Tiny gym Hard bed and uncomfortable pillows

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel but the traffic noise ruined it!”
Reviews.Author: Pyes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights and I feel quite reluctant to write this review as I have no wish to discuss it with the manager. However I did feel other guests should know that if they book a duplex suite it will be on the 'road' side and they will not get any sleep from the constant wail of police cars all night and motorbikes roaring by. I have absolutely no idea why the police cars need to put their sirens on in the middle of the night when there is virtually no traffic apart from a desire to wake the living dead. The hotel manager should be writing a formal letter to the relevant authorities to have this matter dealt with. It is just not necessary to have this level of noise paid for by the overstretched, over taxed Spanish population to have these buffoons racing around playing cops and robbers. We asked about the levels of crime because of the persistent wailings and aparently Madrid has very low levels of crime in the city so maybe they are just practising every night with the dim hope they can do it for real one day. The hotel is very stylish, and very suitable for city breaks and shopping trips. However I would really recommend you book and confirm a room away from the road otherwise you will need horse tranquilisers for a night's sleep. The pool is very small with just a few cramped sunbeds and chairs - with lots of people posing around the pool naval gazing. It is without a doubt a highlight though, as nowhere else in Madrid has one and after a hot day a splash in the pool is very welcome. The staff were very good in the pool bar and very helpful too. I thought the staff were actually quite warm and welcoming in general. We did feel that they were interested in our experience to some extent. I did find the room service breakfast waitress let the service down (hence the drop of a star) as she would stalk into our suite in the morning without a smile or a greeting and would literally dump our tray on the table, and would walk out again. We are used to five star hotels and service and expected a linen table cloth to be laid out and the breakfast to be served properly and with good manners as a bare minimum. In better hotels this would include papers and a pleasant experience. Having said this, I can not leave this note without referencing that the hotel room had style and was very spacious and clean. Clearly lots of thought has been given to the layout and the small details. The hotel is very seductive almost in its atmosphere and you will enjoy the thoughtful design. It is very city slick and if you feel like booking a young, upbeat hotel in an excellent location then dont let this review stop you. Book away from the road and you will have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Style and comfort in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Harryb23
Reviews.Content: Hotel Urban is a stylish, comtemporary hotel in the heart of old Madrid. Design is everything here, from public areas to guest rooms nothing has been left to chance. The hotel gives a fantastic impression of space with glass sided elevators which ascend and descend in the open centre of the building. If this hotel hasn't won some deign award or other then I would be very surprised. Check in was quick and efficient. Staff spoke English and were most welcoming. Maps/guides were provided without having to ask. The hotel is in a perfect location for visiting the tourist highlights of Madrid. we were able to walk to most places and only had to use the Metro to visit Real Madrids ground and the El Rastro street market. For part of our stay one of the two elevators was out of action. When brought back into service the doors appeared a little creaky at times which could alarm some visitors. Throughout the hotel are sculptures and artefacts which add to the sense of luxury. Rooms are very clean and well appointed. we had both a standrad double and a Junior Suite and I would certainly recommend the later for its larger size which is particularly noticeable in the bathroom which had a bath and separate shower. Housekeeping was first class and staff were very pleasant, friendly and attentive to detail. If you were looking for improvements an ipod dock would not be unreasonable in a hotel of this standard. We also missed tea and coffee making facilities whichare available in so many hotels. The rooftop pool is small but this is not surprising considering its location. There are plenty of sunloungers both around the pool and on the adjoining terrace. The terrace bar is well stocked and the service is excellent however it is very expensive. On balance an excellent hotel which we would certainly revisit the next time we are in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel - but too hot.”
Reviews.Author: Hawkeye52241
Reviews.Content: Nice looking hotel. We stayed in a duplex room which had a great layout. Very centrally located - easy walk to museums, Sol, Palazio Real, Retiro, metro stations. Small rooftop pool with bar and restaurant. Reasonable room rates. Looking good - yes? BUT - some problems. 1. The room was way too hot. AC was pathetic. Took 8 hours to get the room to 78 degrees. 2. The room had an energy control slot that required a room key card. So the AC would turn off and the room get hot when we went out. We left a card in it and the cleaning staff removed it every single day!!!! I'm all for green initiatives, but if you are a 5 star hotel you really should at least have robust AC that can cool a room down if you are going to use such a system. Or a fan. And honestly why bother when the WHOLE hotel uses 100-200 watt halogen bulbs throughout? Hello.....ever heard of fluorescent lights? The bedside lights were little heaters in their own right. 3. The restaurant downstairs was closed for August. I know that family owned places do this in Spain, but I expected (a lot) better from a 5 star hotel. The restaurant on the roof was open but was restricted to a tasting menu that cost 90 euros (and was vastly inferior to the 70 euro tasting menus from the michelin starred Comerç 24 and Cinc Sentis restaurants in Barcelona). 4. The front desk kindly arranged a taxi on our departure day, but somehow forgot my single biggest request (that it take a credit cards(). It is not fun to run around an unknown airport trying to find a ATM at 5 am while watching the checkin line get longer and longer. I should give it 1 star but the location, duplex room and rate offsets some of these concerns. Note to the hotel - please do NOT post a generic bland reply to this review. I would like specifics.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: Pidner
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel. The building is very modern and so the rooms, bars and restaurants. The staff is friendly and the location couldn't be better. The only bad thing we found was the small garbage can in the bathroom, which could't fit any size of trash or whatever. Also, if they wanted to add anything to improve their rooms, that would be a music player. We reccomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Urban just ok. It's more 4 stars than 5”
Reviews.Author: heck23
Reviews.Content: I don't want to write a bad review on Urban hotel because it wasn't a bad hotel, but in my opinion it wasn't a 5 start hotel. The staff was nice, the hotel was nice. The pool is super small, but it's location was really cool. We did not eat at the hotel so I can not review the food. At night the Sky Bar was packed and we had a great bottle of wine. The Location of this hotel was perfect!! Very central, close to metro (Sevilla) and close to lots of bars and food. The bad this about the hotel was the AC. The room was HOT!! The AC worked, but it did not cool the room. The AC vent was located above the bathroom door which faced the window. We complained to the front desk, but not sure if they did anything about it. They said someone took a look at the AC and it was working fine. The lighting in the room did not help either. The room had small spotlighting which only made the room hotter. It wasn't a bad hotel, but I don't think I would stay there again, we noticed plenty of 5 star hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN MADRID”
Reviews.Author: remoazul
Reviews.Content: This was our sixth consecutive stay at Hotel Urban. As in the past, a most pleasant experience. Highly skilled and efficient personnel, with a positive and friendly attitude. Willing to go out of their way to offer their help. Modern hotel, fully equipped with a popular "terraza" on the top floor, which remains open till 4 AM !! Central location, near the museums, Old Madrid and the commercial zone. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel in the center of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: hedonism-2010
Reviews.Content: Very nice and modern hotel, perfectly located. Cool design. roof-top bar. Rooms are stylish, new and clean. Staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: sugaraki
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in February for a weekend with friends in Madrid. We were able to book really cheap fares through the hotel's website. I had already visited it for drinks on the roof garden during summertime and I knew it was that impressive as a hotel. Well my impressions stayed the same, our room was very modern and clean. The lights were dim and the colours pale. It wasn't that spacious but not cramped either. THe reception area is quite spectacular, looking like an egyptian museum in different spots. There is a small but stylish bar on the ground floor with great coctails and finger food. It's centrally located and you can walk to Paseo del Museo or plaza del sol. I definitely recommend it especially if you can book cheaper rates.

Reviews.Title: “Uber smart urban hotel”
Reviews.Author: RS11
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a smart, well run, modern city hotel in the thick of it... then look no further. I particularly recommend the hotel restaurant. We arrived late and tired on our first night so decided to eat in. This proved to be the best meal of the weekend and there was some pretty tough competition.

Reviews.Title: “Urban sophistication in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: bsugs
Reviews.Content: If you are heading to Madrid to enjoy the tapas, bars and clubs then the Urban is the place to be to complement your stay! Centrally located everything is to hand, either on foot or for places a little further afield, in one of the readily available taxis. The hotel has a fantastic feel to it with excellent use of steel, glass, woods and leather - an architect’s dream with the towering lobby area, glass lifts and terraces. The glass bar on the ground floor is worth a daytime visit, and a great spot to have an espresso or a cold beer while watching the passers-by peer through the window at the incredible floor and lighting. Later on as the sun sets, head up to the terrace bar and enjoy a cocktail or a glass of champagne before heading out to enjoy Madrid’s evening offerings! The standard rooms are chic and stylish, with the decor continuing to flow through with a great use of woods and leather to offer an exclusive and sophisticated feel. The rooms are not big, but there is more than enough closet space, very comfortable beds and an excellent bathroom. Service is laid back and provided by some of Madrid’s many beautiful people who soon ensure that you feel like you belong and are well and truly part of the Madrid 'IT' crowd - this is not the traditional 5 star hotel experience, but one that is delivered in a very new and more than acceptable way. We visited the Urban as a group of friends, aged between 30 and 50 and I would say that this is the age group that this hotel is looking to appeal to, although I am sure that younger and older couples and groups will enjoy their stay here. Overall the Urban is a great hotel, in a central location that will greatly contribute to a fantastic stay in a wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “Much more than a pretty face”
Reviews.Author: finicky-but-fair
Reviews.Content: Calling the bold design of the hotel flashy would be selling it way short. It is subtle and clever. The glass courtyard is surprisingly warm and intimate. Lighting design throughout is brilliant. Our Junior Duplex room was serene and comfortable. Great bed and linens. Bathroom fixtures, design, lighting were all perfect. Staff throughout were friendly and professional. Definitely coming back to the Urban.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, Hip and in the centre of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: adityamalhotra
Reviews.Content: You will like the decor of this mordern hotel, with its roof top bar, pool. COrridors are neat and rooms, albeit small and well designed. Walking distance to most places in Madrid and approachable to La Latina

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, effortlessly stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: CPFCeagles
Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous time in this lovely, centrally located modern hotel. Exceptional service, fantastic comfortable duplex room with pretty much everything we needed ( fab toiletries including the recently evasive hair conditioner. !!) Complimentary extras offered ( water, glass of champagne etc...) Lovely breakfast in well spaced out breakfast room. Roof terrace really nice just to sit up there above the city. Pool is more of a paddling pool but I guess ok for a quick cooling dip if up there sunbathing. Handy for the ' golden triangle' and all the major central sites. Loved it and fully recommend the duplex room- just as the photos show- bed downstairs and sofa, coffee table and extra tv upstairs. Didnt find tea/ coffee maker and a ipod player would have been nice

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to visit Madrid and stay !”
Reviews.Author: Confmanager
Reviews.Content: We had four days there and the hotel was perfectly situated. 100 meters from the city centre. Beautiful and designed hotel. Great place ! well for us and the room was nice.

Reviews.Title: “A formerly stylish hotel, now tired and shabby.”
Reviews.Author: TravelDaddy65
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Urban several times in years past and was looking forward to another visit. I was disappointed. The decor has not been updated since it opened, and is looking dated and sad. The place is also getting shabby --scratched floors, chipped tiles, peeling paint and wall covering are common and distracting problems. The service has also become sloppy. The front desk staff is still very helpful, but the maid service is haphazard and sloppy. The management needs to invest some serious time and money into updating and renovating this property before I would consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! A stylish stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: interpol81
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Urban for a long weekend and we loved it! The location, the ambience, the décor.. it was exactly what we were looking for! We booked our room directly through the hotel’s website and got a good rate compared to others. Urban is in the heart of the city: some of the major attractions of Madrid are walking distance and the metro station (Sevilla) is just around the corner. Staff at the reception were so kind and helpful, with lots of suggestions for dinner and nightlife. Unfortunately the pool area on the roof was close due to the bad weather (we were there in April) but it seemed that is the place to be in Madrid during the hottest months. Glass Bar in the ground floor was nice and always packed with people during the evenings, with good drinks and music. There’s also a restaurant but we couldn’t try it as we got too many things to do in just a couple of days. We stayed in a Junior Suite, an amazing room overlooking the stunning atrium of Urban (more quiet than the rooms overlooking the road). We loved the bathroom with glass walls, Philippe Starck furniture, and a huge hydromassage bathtub. Wi-Fi is everywhere but is NOT free of charge (and I didn’t like it), but a free cable connection is available in every room, and you’ll find two computers with internet in the lobby. If you are looking for a stylish location in Madrid, near all the major attractions, this design hotel would be a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Ultra modern hotel - Very helpful staff and cool pool area”
Reviews.Author: michaelnotwinner
Reviews.Content: Stunning looking hotel. The thing that stands out is the helpfulness of the staff and the concierges in particular. They booked Bullfights (I know it’s not PC for everyone!), recommended restaurants and places to go. The breakfasts were awesome with great fresh orange juice and fruit as well as a cooked option. The rooftop pool area is a great place to relax and cool down, taking a break from the heat of the city. On the down side the food and drink is expensive by Madrid standards but not compared to any other major city. The wooden floors in our room had been terribly scratched which was a pity as the rest of the room and hotel communal areas is in great shape. Great location, near to main museums, restaurants and shops. Would definitely go back and recommend to others Traveller's tip on dining Dine out in the Latina area where most of the locals eat. Go to the Mercado de San Miguel near Plaza Mayor for tapas - a pretty unique experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Thousandeurist
Reviews.Content: Every bit: from its location where you should be when in Madrid, stylish décor and ultra-cool bars, to the very professional and helpful staff, or the outstanding food, to mention just a few, the overall experience is flawless. It might be because we stayed in a suite – spacious with a living that enclosed three sofas, dining table, LCD tv set and dvd player, as well as sleeping area, with a king size bed, another flat screen tv, a wardrobe with enough space to storage your stuff and the gem of them all: the bathroom, cleverly appointed with shower and Jacuzzi, separated from the living room by a glass (don’t worry if you are of the shy type: there is an automated system to get it obscured from the living). A great night of sleep is almost guaranteed. Not to mention the art pieces scattered all over the room, awesome! We have breakfast there; you have a good selection of continental and English with also Madrid delicacies. Best orange juice we have ever had in a hotel breakfast The art collection is also worth mentioned. It is unlikely you should have the opportunity to enjoy original pieces of ancient Asian and Egyptian art anywhere else as handy. Not to miss: Roof-pool bar (if in summer, try any of the cocktails when sunset to enjoy and fully appreciate the famous colours changes over the Madrid sky), Glass bar (in the lobby, go directly for the champagne), any of the restaurants: Cielo (up in the roof has a magic light at night) or Europa Decó (smart decoration, relaxed atmosphere). Creative Mediterranean menu with some exotic extras. It would make your trip to Madrid unforgettable. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Your safe choice for Madrid - If you enjoy a hard modern bed, in a small, but trendy room”
Reviews.Author: PerfectStay
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right in the middle of down town Madrid. If you go out and to the left, a short walk will bring you to things like the royal castle, famous places, great tapas places and town squares. If you go out the door and to the right you will reach the huge park and upscale shopping district after a short promenade. In other words, the location is great. The hotel has a tasty exterior and the interior to go with it. The rooms are decorated in very trendy décor. There are plenty of spotlights all over and two control panels will set the right mood with a touch of a button. I love a trendy room, but I don’t like when it goes on the behalf of comfort. This were the issue with the business desk in the room that had a very trendy chair with no back rest and the bed that looked nice, but was hard as a rock to sleep in (for my taste, even if I spoke with colleagues that thought it were ok) Room was relatively small and I found it difficult to find a logical place to put my briefcase. Service was ok’ish.. For a 5 star hotel it was not what I would expect, but it also depended on who you spoke with. Breakfast was good with a fair selection and possibility to order a hot meal – oh, and I love when they add a little twist on the breakfast and offer something different. This is the only hotel I’ve been to in Madrid and even if I might end up picking something else the next time I would also recommend this as a safe choice when visiting this fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “They turn off the air-con in winter!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTrekker84
Reviews.Content: Right.. i'm going to get to the point. The hotel is in a good location and is very stylish. However, the negatives completely dwarf any positives. Without turning this into a rant... the biggest issue was that the hotel turns off its central air-conditioning in the winter. Hence, you can only heat the rooms... and not cool them! I thought this was completely unacceptable for a so called '5* hotel'. During a hot weekend this meant the room was unbearable... Combine unbearable heat with a rock-hard bed.... and you have the worst night sleep ever! Safe yourself the hassle... and don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “some noise near the lifts”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel17a
Reviews.Content: This is just as stylish and as comfy as everyone says it is (an aesthetic pleasure to ride in the lift!). Just wish I had heeded a message I think is on here, to book well away from the lifts, where there is a fair bit of clatter, and a contrast to the irreproachable sound insulation on the side of the busy street. Thw wash hand basin in the bathroom was stylishly huge, with a large slab of marble in the bottom around which the water disappeared - but no way to ensure that my contact lens wouldn't go the same way when I took it out! When a hotel is so self-consciously stylish, impracticalities like having to walk out of the bathroom to prevent this, grate a bit. (As does the fact that the description of the behind-glass antique in my room had been effaced by the cleaner, so I didn't know the details of what I was looking at) - But maybe this is splitting hairs...

Reviews.Title: “Classy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jc95164
Reviews.Content: After 2 weeks of travel in Europe with stays at known, upscale hotel chains, we ended up at the Urban Hotel in Madrid. Not having heard of the Urban, we weren't sure what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised from the moment we arrived. The front desk staff was outstanding as they helped us with directions, currency exchange, dining suggestions and a pleasant smile at all times. The room was large by European standards and very tastefully decorated. Bathroom amenities were first class and maid service excellent. The bar was a "happening" place and always busy. On Sunday, they had a brunch which had a wide selection of delicious treats. The morning breakfast buffet in the restaurant included eggs to order and a nice variety of breakfast items. The location was perfect for the tourist looking to be centrally located. We were 1 block from the Gran Via, 2 blocks from Plaza del Sol, 4 blocks from Plaza Mayor and around the corner from the Prado Museum. The Urban definately lives up to it's 5 star rating

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Loves_good_things
Reviews.Content: If you like quality, then stay at The Urban! It's a beautiful hotel, in a great location and the service was top notch! The staff were friendly and extremely helpful. We splurged and booked a duplex room (which has 2 levels). The room was beautifully decorated and had many cool things (great lighting, cool real art, motion sensors & electronic black out blinds) . It was a little small, but still comfortable. My only issue with the room was that the TVs were quite small. The blinds were great and the soundproofing of the windows was excellent. All of the staff really made us feel like we were important and bent over backwards to help us. The location is excellent and very close to shopping and the city center (Sol). In addition to this wonderful hotel, I highly recommend a Segway tour with www.madsegs.com. It's a great way to see the city and was tons of fun!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous stylish and trendy hotel in the centre of madrid”
Reviews.Author: gianni0567
Reviews.Content: I have used the hotels of the Derby group before and when they say 5 star Gran Luxo, they mean it. OK so I am a little biased because I booked through tablethotels and got upgraded to a duplex suite for the price of a normal room. Still there are certain things that are undeniable - The location of the hotel is great, 5 minutes walk from puerta del sol - The rooms are clean and stylishly decorated, the bathroom is quite spacious - The buffet breakfast is magnificent and was included (so was the internet) - The staff was incredibly helpful in every aspect at an undeniably busy time for all (new years eve), finding me a restaurant at short notice for the NYE dinner - Ok so our bedroom also had a mini walk-in wardrobe that really sold it to me (I felt very Carrie Bradshaw in all this) and roof windows you could hear the rain tapping against Let's be clear - this is not for the shoestring traveller - it's not cheap. But it's 5 out of 5 for me. For the same price (USD 350) in New York you get a shoe box with no window and snotty staff, you have to pay for breakfast and they charge you 15 bucks for the internet. I am really not sure what what some people on this site have to complain about....

Reviews.Title: “Stylish city break in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: belgian_professor
Reviews.Content: We went to Madrid for a short city trip in August. City was sweltering hot but the Urban Hotel proved a cool experience. We arrived by taxi and were greeted by welcoming staff. Were able to check in immediately. We had booked a standard suite, which was perfect: clean, cool and stylishly decorated - think Barcelona chair. Up on the roof there is a small (but really big enough for its purposes) swiming pool and comfortable sun chairs. Tip: go up there and watch the sun set over the city. There's also a bar on top of the hotel that serves swanky drinks and finds itself a venue for Madrid's elegant types - think D&G crowd. Cocktails are nice but pricey: 12-15 euro price range. We had a great experience and we recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Madrid. Only recommendation to management: Please inform the French female bar tender downstairs (yes, there's also a cocktail bar on the ground floor) that it's okay to smile while serving cocktails. In fact, it may get here some extra tips...

Reviews.Title: “good, not great”
Reviews.Author: T_Belgique
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel, my room wasn't ready yet but they told me that they would call me when it was avaialble, due to bad communication, I was waiting in the lobby for 3 hours, then I decided to ask if my room was available, they told me it was, whitout informing me. But the genuinely friendlyness of the staff made me forget about this! The hotel looks great from the outside and the public places are lovely as well. I booked a deluxe suite, but when I entered the room I just didn;t had the "wow-feeling", It was a dark room with few windows a separate lounge, a modern bathroom with jacuzzi and a bedroom. The room was old, dirty walls, crack in the walls, they really needed to re-do the painting and the tv's are of a really bad quality. The bathroom looked really nice and was spacious but the jacuzzi made the noise of a plane taking off, not really relaxing after a jetlag! After a couple of houres, the staff entered with a bottle of water and flowers and my newspaper was delivered into my room as requested! Because the hotel was a bit boring, I moved to the Me By Melia and had a room with lovely views over the St Anna place. Although the rooms were smaller, there were a lot more amenities and the rooms looked a lot fresher. In general, the staf of the Urban Hotel was amazing but the room lacked of personality and needed more amenities and some refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Moderately pricey, but definitely worth it”
Reviews.Author: davidxray122
Reviews.Content: Located right in the heart of the central cultural/sightseeing distract. Beautiful, modern hotel, spotlessly clean, excellent front desk service. Very hip look, with modern , high tech look and great New Guinea art work for contrast. Expensive, but worth it! Booked a higher end room, had a loft with couch and TV above the main bedroom. Great access to all the top sights in Madrid. Safe. We are a very particular couple, and were both 110% happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: CCHLondon
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. We stayed last week in a deluxe suite - the room was very spacious with a large combined living and sleeping area which contained two sofas, a flat screen tv, dvd player and a separate dining table. We particularly liked the large bathroom (which is divided by a glass screen from the living room) and the jacuzzi jet bath. I'd agree with the other comments about the beds - they are a tad hard and the pillows provided a little lacking in support but we still slept great. The rest of the hotel looks terrific, very modern and smart, and the roof terrace and bar is a nice thing to have on a sunny evening. Great value as well at just over 200 euros per night for the suite. We would most definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Impressive and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: boottraveler
Reviews.Content: We were transfered to this hotel when our other hotel apparently had issues with water. The hotel has an impressive inside and very luxurious decor. We had a suite... it was a bit small for a "suite" but very luxurious and the service was very good. The swiming pool (located on the terrace) is not for swiming (very small) and the water is so cold (even in the high heat of summer) that it is hard to use it. The breakfast is massively expensive given that a block away there are numerous "cafeterias" where you will eat better and pay a fraction of what costs you at the hotel. Location could not be better!!! If anything this hotel is worth it becasue you are in the middle of everytyhing (walking distance) and in the most prestigious area (e.g. the Ritz is only a block away and so is the Prado museum). The bed was a bit hard but overall I found the hotel and accomodations comfortable. Service was impecable!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: eb500
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel - room was very nice although a little on the small side. Location was excellent. Even the service, which always seems to be the struggle for us with hotels in Spain, was quite good. Poll on troof was a very nice added bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Chic, cool, but...”
Reviews.Author: RedFred1000
Reviews.Content: A very cool and trendy hotel in downtown Madrid, where you are made to feel at home from the moment the doorman greets you. Friendly, efficient check-in, striking furnishings and decor, chic bedrooms. And on the roof, a cocktail bar and pool (well, a large bath, and less than 1m deep) and gym (well, two or three exercise machines). So yes we loved it, although we niggled at the bedroom lights ( the only way we could find to turn them all off was to pull our room card out of the slot) and the mattress ( a tad too hard). We would stay there again, but if it was full and I had to stay somewhere else, then I'd be mildly disappointed rather than deeply frustrated that I couldn't get in.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: MiamiBeachPaul
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with this hotel. The design and decore were gorgeous, and the whole experience was pretty flawless. We upgraded to a larger room and found it to be very comfortable. The ONLY real flaw was the bed was not as comfortable as I'm used to, with the pillows being rather flimsy (we simply ordered a few extra ones). The service was quick and helpful, and the ammenities of the hotel were top notch. I'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sippin Bourbon in Hotel Urban”
Reviews.Author: ChristianYorke
Reviews.Content: Our trip got off to a bad start, stuck on the runway at Heathrow for an hour whilst BA tried to fix some catastrophic electrical fault on the plane. I can't remember the last time I flew BA and wasn't delayed. We landed in Madrid after midnight and I was pleased to see a small army of taxis ready for action. The problem was that none of the taxi drivers had ever heard of the Hotel Urban. I approached three drivers amid lots of shrugging and whistling through teeth. After a while a huddle of taxi drivers formed. When I insisted that the hotel was in Madrid one driver kindly explained that Madrid "is a big place." In the end I had to get the hotel web site on my Blackberry (I'd long since lost all the paperwork) to find its address. This was not easy. The address is buried deep in the site, but eventually I found the details and off we went. It was almost 2am when we arrived and I was expecting more problems. I shouldn't have worried. The check-in at the Urban could not have been better; efficient, polite and mercifully quick. Our room was a duplex suite (it had been on offer!). The ground floor had the bathroom, walk-in wardrobe, TV and a large comfortable bed. Upstairs was another TV, leather sofa, mini bar and a balcony overlooking the bedroom. The beers were cold but the aircon struggled to cool the place even though I immediately had it on full blast. In the morning we checked out the roof terrace. There is a pool but be warned; the maximum depth is 2'6'' and the small pool area gets very busy. The Glass Bar is the hotel's "destination bar." It is a light, modern area situated off the impressive lobby; good for sipping hard liquor before a night out. I was slightly surprised that despite the "no smoking" signs people were merrily sucking their Marlboros. We were in Madrid for a weekend and had lunch at the outside terrace of the Ritz. Hotel Urban cannot compete with the Ritz's grandeur. However, the Urban enjoys an excellent location, great staff, a good bar, good facilities and a cool modern vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Not that good”
Reviews.Author: Squirrel2009
Reviews.Content: The design of this hotel is really amazing, but the rooms are very small and not very comfortable. The breakfast is overpriced.Location is quite good but I'd better stay in other 5-star hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel, good location, great bar”
Reviews.Author: MarkandCat
Reviews.Content: Agree with most of the other reviews, would say 4 start rather than 5, rooms a bit small and not a lot of storage, bathrooms are great, overall looking just a bit jaded now for a 5 star. Great bar though - Glass bar? Excellent fro a glass of champagne or a Mojito before heading out, popular with locals and full of "beautiful people" (and us!)

Reviews.Title: “Warning: beds are extremely hard”
Reviews.Author: zyle
Reviews.Content: The beds in Urban Hotel Madrid are extremely hard. This may not bother you if you usually sleep on a very hard surface such as a floor. But if you don't, you may find as i did that you wake up with sore muscles. Do you wanna take that chance? On the plus side, there is a pool, open in the afternoon only, but it's very small and max depth 0.87m.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Modern Size with Super-Modern Fittings.”
Reviews.Author: BrilloAido
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the Easter break. We booked a standard double room, which was small, and as the wardrobe can’t hold everything, it meant that you are always tripping up over your own stuff (bags, shoes, etc). An annoying feature was the fiddly wardrobe door which was one mid-folding large door, which when opened meant that you couldn’t get around the bed to the other side of the room without having to close it (not as easy as it sounds). Our room overlooked the street, so no view as such. Loved the trendy bathroom, and the shower was one of the best I’ve used. Weather wasn’t good enough to use the plunge pool, so can’t comment on that, other than it’s really a very large bath rather than a pool. With breakfast at an extra 45euro for the pair of us, we always eat in a local café. Staff where friendly and everything was spotless, though cleaning staff seem to expect everyone to be up & out at 9am (unless you fancy a Ménage-à-trios involving the cleaner, my advise is to lock your door). Complementary wine in the room was a nice touch, as was free web access near reception. In summary, this is a trendy hotel in an ideal location. Fine for sleeping, showering and changing, but it’s not the place you would want to chill out in for a week or two.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, happening, teeny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jackthedog
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel has a 5 star ranking, I'd give it 4 stars, simply because the rooms were so small. We loved the design, the service (although the front desk seemed to always be overwhelmed). The fitness room is no bigger than a large closet. Great location in the thick of things.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, smart room, quite expensive.”
Reviews.Author: hafgrape
Reviews.Content: Location is great for visiting madrid, and you can walk pretty much everywhere. Some great restaurants on the doorstep. Staff were very helpful. Room was quite noisy, we could hear next door in the morning and housekeeping. Disappointed that the terrace wasn't open even though it was a very hot weekend. Rooms were small and we've stayed in better 5 star hotels but it was fine for a capital city. Would stay again but would check that terrace and pool were open first.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you're a Smoker”
Reviews.Author: govinda8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location if you plan on visiting the Prado, Reina Sofia, and/or Thyssen museums. It's a beautiful building, and we stayed in a duplex suite that was large and comfortable. The bathroom was gorgeous and the collection of Egyptian jewelry the hotel has is amazing. On the downside, the hotel website doesn't mention that only the 2nd floor of the hotel is non-smoking. The email room confirmation didn't mention this either. The first two nights were fine, but chain-smokers were in a room adjacent to ours on the last night and every puff was sucked into our AC. We asked to be moved to a non-smoking room and were told there weren't any available and in the morning were offered a free breakfast for our trouble. If you are AT ALL sensitive to smoke I would only stay on the 2nd floor. It's unfortunate since the duplex suite was so gorgeous. Bonus* There is a pretty good vegetarian restaurant RIGHT around the corner, which is wonderful considering the difficulty of finding something to eat sans pork in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet and great staff”
Reviews.Author: restrapo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Urban is a good hotel. Location is great for navigating throughout Madrid but in particular for the musuems and other attractsions on the Prada. This is a luxury hotel. However, do not expect luxury on the scale of US. Hotel is relatively small. Only downside was that house keeping started early (around 8am, at the latest) and I could hear them in the hallway as if to say get up sleepy head. Some what distracting given the well known late hours of Madrilenos. Again, overall good hotel but would suggest removing label of high end luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: janik12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights, and loved it. great central location!! staff were extremely helpful in helping with suggestions and answering all questions. rooms are kinda small but to be expected for a european hotel. beds comfy and quiet night sleep .greeted with some candy and bottle of wine.free internet access daily, which is a plus. great drinks at the glass bar with good crowd and vibe. overall a plus!

Reviews.Title: “disappointing after a good start”
Reviews.Author: dilvangogh
Reviews.Content: complete mixed bag for our stay at the urban ,service friendly efficient and attentive from check in through the bar and restaurant ,chic and fun .The location is very good for the major tourist spots .Unfortunately sleeping in the hotel is another matter ,noisy ,small beds and rooms also a little on the small side as to the gym they would have been better of not bothering with it .Overall a disappointment once you left the ground floor .

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Urban.”
Reviews.Author: D4
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard double room. Room was a good enough size, quiet and as you can see from all the travellers photo’s looks fantastic with it’s contemporary decor and has been done to a very high standard. Good location. Staff were friendly and helpful. Loved the area on the roof for chilling out after a hard days traipsing around being a tourist. (Pool tiny though) Agree with all other positive reviews on this hotel. It is pricy but I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and central”
Reviews.Author: prof_crunch
Reviews.Content: This chic hotel combines a central location with a contemporary look and excellent service. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived (to be fair, it was still mid-morning) but the reception staff - who spoke excellent English - did offer to store our luggage in the meantime. The stylish rooms are quiet, comfortable and offer a slew of mod-cons. The bathroom features a separate area for the toilet and bidet, which I didn't quite feel brave enough to try. The trough-style sink (replete with two mixer taps) is so modern it doesn't even appear to have a plughole. And the enormous cascade shower is a real treat. The main bedroom area features the usual large desk, two-seater sofa, flatscreen telly and mini bar. There's a clever system that allows you to switch between four levels of brightness across the room's lights, in addition to an electric blackout blind. Unfortunately, the enormous wardrobe combined with the room's slightly narrow dimensions meant that the TV had been placed in front of the sofa, not at the foot of the bed, limiting your ability to indulge in the classic hotel pastime of lying in bed watching the box. Head up to the sixth floor and you'll discover great terrace bar, which features both an indoor area and plenty of outside seating. There's also a rooftop pool, although its diminutive size means that it's closer to being a paddling pool as opposed to a proper swimming pool. If you've got the budget for it, this is an ultra-modern and well-located hotel that is a treat to stay in - just as long as you don't want to watch TV in bed or do much swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Pefecto Madrid - The City That Never Sleeps!”
Reviews.Author: VanDwaas
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Hotel Urban in Madrid to celebrate my wife's birthday. The staff throughout the hotel are warm and friendly, with a can do attitude. Nothing is too much trouble, there is always a member of staff on hand to answer your questions. The reception staff all speak fluent English (although I always make an effort to try and communicate in the native language where possible) and the check in process efficient. There if free internet access with two computers and a printer adjacent to the reception area for guests to use. The hotel's main restaurant "Europa Deco" is to the left of the main entrance (as you enter the front door of the hotel). Try the "Red Tuna Fish Taster" to start, if you like Sushi. Try the Beef for a main if you are a red meat lover. Delicious. We booked a standard room which was perfectly adequate for the two of us. It was clean, modern, well equipped and featured a superb rainforest shower in the bathroom leaving you refreshed and ready to hit the town. On the negative side, don't expect to get too much sleep as the rooms are far from soundproof and the noise created by the flow of traffic and people passing the outside the hotel is more or less constant at all hours of the day and night. However, you don't go to Madrid for peace and quiet! If you want the peaceful life, Madrid is not for you. Take a Madrid Vision sightseeing tour bus (Day Pass is 16 Euros per adult) from stop 12 for the Historical tour or stop 1 for the Modern Tour (see the interactive maps on the Madrid Vision website for details - www.madridvision.es/en/index.php). The Historical tour takes in the Royal Palace. On the modern tour you can get off at stop 7 and take a tour of Real Madrid Football Club's "Estadio Santiago Bernabeu" for 15 Euros per adult. The tour includes the museum and trophy room. You can sit in the seats in the President's Box then walk down the steps and sit on the heated leathers seats on the player's bench pitchside before going down the tunnel into the dressing room (only the visitor's/away team dressing room is open to the public at present). If it's a particularly hot and sunny day, visit the boating lake at the Parc De Retiro and hire a rowing boat for 4 Euros and 40 cents per boat (not per person). Each boat can sit up to 4 adults. Great value. For tapas and flamenco in the evening visit Casa Patas (www.casapatas.com). Advanced booking is recommended, however we just turned up at 11pm, ate some Tapas and booked our flamenco tickets (30 Euros per adult - but well worth it) which were delivered to our table. The flamenco show began at midnight (in the auditorium/back room at the rear of the restaurant) and lasted approximately two hours including a short interval. It was fantastic! You ill not be disappointed. Casa Patas a friendly, welcoming establishment and you can order drinks to your table at any time during the show. There is something for everyone to enjoy in Madrid and we will definitely be returning to this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great design -- they do Schrager better than Schrager”
Reviews.Author: LaTravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband and two young kids (ages 4 and 7) at Hotel Urban in Madrid in early July. While it is not what I would typically call a "family hotel," they were incredibly accommodating, especially after Hotels.com messed up and booked 4 of us into 1 room. (Hotel Urban only allows 3 people to a room unless the 4th is in a crib.) The front desk staff was phenomenal and first moved us from the duplex room that we had booked (very cool concept), into a beautiful junior suite, and then borrowed a roll-away bed from another hotel to accommodate the 4th person in our group. So over the course of the 4-5 days we stayed at the hotel, we got a good view of a few different room types and service, and thought it was all outstanding. I love modern design, so I was very interested in this hotel, but the real reason I chose it was because it is one of only 3 hotels in central Madrid (near the Puerta del Sol, Museo del Prado, etc.) that has a pool. We were warned repeatedly about how hot Madrid would be in July (and had experienced intense heat in Seville and Grenada), so with the kids in tow I thought the pool was important. We ended up having great temperate weather while we were there -- it was in the mid 70s to 80 during our stay, so we didn't need the pool that much, which was good because it is very tiny! (Think two king size beds stacked end to end.) The hotel also attracts a very young male alternative lifestyle crowd, which was totally fine, but we got a more up-close look at that culture by the small pool. Now to the design -- I love modern but admittedly have been getting sick of the Ian Schrager "dark hotel" model. As a woman who travels alone for work a lot, I actually hated walking up to my room after 10pm at night in some of his hotels b/c I don't feel safe, as hip as they are. Hotel Urban gets around the muted light by putting a center glass-enclosed atrium with natural light in the middle of the hotel. Throughout the hotel there is actual art work ranging from Pacific Islander large-scale wood carvings, to a small Egyptian art museum in the basement. The rooms themselves are efficiently designed. We were first in a duplex standard hotel room -- a first for me. It has a bath, walk in closet and queen size bed with TV on entry level, and then a small staircase to a loft living room with TV and bar area upstairs. It was quite chic and gave a feeling of spaciousness, although the room was a bit hot (b/c the ceiling over the bed was slanted with skylights and automated shades.) The junior suite was a little more logical in design -- and L shaped space with the living area by the entryway, a huge glass enclosed bath suite (with automated privacy shades), and the bed area on the other side of the L. The only issue was that there is no window to the outside (the windows also looked into the atrium). Overall, we were very impressed with the design, definitely with the service after the web-partner messed up our reservation, the value, and the great central location.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff is like a family...Bravo!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravellerCY
Reviews.Content: I believe this is one of the best Hotels somebody should expect of finding on his way , while traveling. The staff is like a family, helpful and interested to offer their best for the customer. Never had such a service before. Even the porters care to make your day. The Hotel is centrally located , very well designed and with a great atmosphere. Avoid the 5th floor: too loud due to a lounge on the 6th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JCLON
Reviews.Content: The staff is very efficient and professional. I asked for an ironing board at Check In, it was in my room 5 minutes after I walked in. I ordered RS lunch which was delivered in less than 15 minutes. The hotel is on a main road but the double glazing is so good that the rooms are very quiet. The building and the decor of the public areas is very original. On the down side, the fine dining restaurant (Cielo) is pricey (€200 set menu excluding drinks). Rooms are a on the small side.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: luxlovernyc
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the sister hotel in Barcelona, the Claris, and since we didn't like that, we had some trepidation about the Urban. It was a much better experience. The hotel is newer and better maintained and the staff couldn't have been nicer. Although we booked a more basic room (deluxe) vs. a junior suite at the Claris, we liked this room better. It looked out over the main street, was bright and sunny, but had great soundproofing and blackout shades. Although small, iut was very well laid out, with a great closet and good storage. The bedding and towels were great. The pool was really small and again, little or no shade until late in the day, and hard to get lounges. Still, a pleasant way to cool down in the early evening. The location was fabulous -- you could walk to the Prado in 5 minutes and the other two museums in 10 and the train station in 15. There was a Starbucks 3 blocks away for a reasonably priced breakfast or coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city location”
Reviews.Author: lodea
Reviews.Content: This hotel is central and everywhere is within walking distance. The design is modern and the art is amazing. The entire experience was faultless. The check in was effortless, even though we arrived at 10:30am, our room was immediately available. The suite was internally oriented (total sound proofing and AC was not intrusive) with Glass walled bathroom. Very cool. Bed was comfortable and the lighting was so adaptable. No pay TV.........so what. Housekeeping was very attentive and considerate of the late sleep in.............mandatory with Madrid's night life. Hotel rooftop bar was a highlight even though it was a little quiet, but it was a great place to have cocktails and watch the sun go down. All staff were friendly and courteous. Did not eat in the hotel as the restaurants seem quiet, which is a time of theyear issue. Booked to stayed in its sister Hotel the Claris in Barcelona in 3 weeks!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the ultra modern design and roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: GladaAnkan
Reviews.Content: Hotel Urban certainly exceeded our expectations! The staff is really polite and friendly and go out their way to help you carry your bags, book restaurants etc. We mentioned that our bidé was leaking a bit of water. Since we hadn't been planning on spending our vaction on the bidé anyway, we didn't really mind that it was broken. However, we were immediatelu upgraded to a suite and were of course very happy about that! The rooms are ultra modern and especially the bathrooms are impressive - I would just love to have a bathroom like that at home! Apart from that, you should definetely also take some time to just hang out at the pool with a drink in your hand and enjoy the lounge music and the view of the rooftops of Madrid - priceless!

Reviews.Title: “Feelt not very welcome after one night!!”
Reviews.Author: Ozzy29
Reviews.Content: Well.. I had a good price for a room which normally cost much more( I paid 185Euros a day) but normally I expect more from a 5star hotel. It was very hot and there were not even water for free in the rooms. The Gym was a simple room without music and only 3-4 machines. No water there either!! Nothing I can call a gym. And the pool was very small..for two it was ok but not more... Coctail Drinks cost almost 15Euro and water 4 Euro in terrasse bar. I booked twin double bed but got single double bed. The room was not so spacious but you could call it normal size with the choice of the small furnitures. I had to close my suitcase since no dedicated space for it!! Only positive point was that there was a complimentary halv liter of wine which tasted very well... And also the AC worked well and the window was good sound pfoofed! Normaly there should be some snacks (fruit) and water in the rooms and the morning coffe/tea and newspaper is what I was expecting from 5 star hotel. When I adviced the reception regarding some issues like no water and breakfeast not beeing included, I felt very unwelcome.. I guess I will change hotel before ending my time out here!! I would not recommend this hotel unles the location is very necessery and no other hotels around is available.

Reviews.Title: “Urban-smart hotel lacking the finer details...”
Reviews.Author: Raffles.dk
Reviews.Content: Our first night was in a standard room as the suites were all booked out, which left us with an awfull experience of a blocked drainage-pipe with a serious back-draft problem, resulting in a bath suitable for HELL. Though this incident wasn't as such the direct fault of the hotel - but merely some prior visitors who must have been disgusting! This resulted in a disgusting bathtub, that wasn't cleaned despite the room was serviced by turn-down service, and we had serious doubts if this place was anywhere near 5 stars! The following 10 days we stayed in a suite - that provided us with much better bathroom experience and not as cramped surroundings, hence more comfortable living style. During this time we got a fair impression of the hotel. First of all what springs to mind is the lack of the minor but important details - such as a music system and optional down-pillows - which we normally expect from a 5 star hotel, that takes the pride of calling itself Grand Luxe. When staying for a longer period these are details that matters. First of all we want to acknowledge the staff that has really proven to live up to the 5 stars this hotel prides itself with. The doormen are always friendly and ready to assist from the moment they spot you (as regular guests). The casually clothed bell-boys/service staff are alert and on the toes at ALL times, providing the best of service one would expect from this category of hotels. Most front desk staff are very attentive, helpfull and proficient in English, however it is sad that some of the staff simply lacks English language skills, that one expects from an international 5 star hotel. This wouldn't matter if the staff were paired so that one would always be capable of understanding English on a basic level, unfortunately this wasn't always what we experienced. Simple requests such as asking for turn-down service were ignored / not followed up on. The very friendly and serviceminded front-desk manager and general manager will be looking into this though - and we do expect they will be changing some procedures in this matter! Besides from the small details, that really defines an exceptional five star hotel, this hotel is a smart and very comfortable right in the middle of Madrid, and we have no problem staying at again. General I would classify the hotel as five stars - but no where near Grand Luxe! Simple things: such as after several days having to ask for newspapers (despite being asked at checkin what newspapers one wants to be provided with), the lack of music system and optional pillows - does make a difference!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, 5 star rooms ?”
Reviews.Author: Geraint01
Reviews.Content: Great staff & nice atmosphere. Rooms however pretty small, and a bit too ikea for my liking. Location is excellent, their 'Glass Bar' is best avoided.

Reviews.Title: “1st Anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: AmandaStrachan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the previous reviews which we read. We booked a suite and were not disappointed. The jacuzzi bath and shower room were excellent. The bathroom was very luxurious as was the rest of the suite which had electric blinds and different light settings to enhance the ambience of the room. The rooms were clean and tidy. However, we also thought that the fried eggs on the pillow were a little strange and would have preferrred a chocolate. We also visited the glass bar each night for a drink before heading out. The cocktails were lovely and the sushi tapas were excellent. The staff in the hotel were very friendly and helpful and were excellent at recommending restaurants, bars and nightclubs and also very good at giving directions. However, beware of booking anything via the hotel as we bought bull fighting tickets through them and were charged 4 times the price. Face value was 10 euros and we paid 40 euro each. I would suggest trying to purchase them directly from the Plaza de Toro at Ventas or an official ticket outlet before asking the hotel to buy them for you. The location is excellent and just 5 minute walk to Sol and Gran Via. We would also highly recommend going on a madsegs tour - see www.madsegs.com. This is a fantastic way to get round madrid. The guides Antony and Marta were very friendly and showed us things that you won't normally see during a stay in Madrid. Overall, an enjoyable 3 night stay in madrid. Would definitely recommend the hotel if you have never been before but we will maybe try somewhere different next time.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: citytravellerplus
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at Hotel Urban for 3 nights in August to celebrate my birthday. We have absolutely no complaints whatsoever about this hotel. I would disagree with previous posts that have described the rooms as small. We stayed in a standard room and thought the rooms were an ideal size. They are luxuriously decorated and very clean. Only very minor gripe would be that there was no CD player. Hotel location is superb. It is a 5 minute stroll from the Prado museum, plaza Santa Ana and is a 15 minute walk from the Salamanca district. Staff are very friendly, always someone nearby to carry your case, open doors, provide restaurant recommendations etc. All the services you would expect from a 5 star establishment. Each night we had drinks in the Glass bar. If you want to pay a little bit extra to drink in style then this is the place for you. It costs 6 euros for a beer and 15 euros for most cocktails. Also had drinks in the rooftop terrace which is great for night time views of the city. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant on this occasion. However, on the second night of our stay we had dinner at a restaurant called Mumbai Masala (indian fusion cuisine) and it was genuinely the best indian food I have ever sampled. Would certainly recommend it to anyone who likes this type of food. Madrid is a superb, clean and safe city and we cant wait to return. Really liked the fact that it isnt over commercialised and is successfully retaining it’s identity, for example, most of the restaurant menus are written in Spanish (which can be a bit hazardous if you don’t have a basic understanding of the language!)

Reviews.Title: “Very good..... but not cheap”
Reviews.Author: emceeManchester
Reviews.Content: I read most of the recent reviews before I booked.......& that still didn't put me off!!! I stayed at the sister hotel, The Claris in Barcelona, some four years ago, so I was aware of what to expect. This is a five star hotel with prices to match. This is in no way a criticism. I had a marvellous experience from the doorman, reception staff, hotel room, etc. For instance when the (one & only!) visitors computer was unavailable, reception staff let me use their own- at no cost. Location is great- just down the street is the Thyssen art collection. It's also located away from any busy streets or plazas, so relatively quiet. The room & bath room were very well fitted out with good quality furnishing & bed linen. Bit of a shame about the cheap TV- but then I wasn't really in Madrid to sit & watch TV. Just a couple of points to note. As it's a five star hotel the room rate is high, the drinks & food are also very high. So what! Just go outside to a nearby plaza & have a drink watching the world go by for at least 50% less. Secondly be aware that the rooftop pool/sitting area/bar becomes a "nightclub" after 10pm. So when I returned to my room at 12 midnight I was met by a long queue for the (only!!) two lifts in the building waiting to go up to the roof! This clearly needs effective management but is a minor gripe. Just ensure you don't get a high level room if you want a good night's sleep. I was on the third floor at the front & didn't hear a thing. Finally be aware that, in addition to the substantial external glazing system to the front of the building, there is an electronically operated blackout blind. It's so effective you could easily wake up at midday & think it was still the middle of the night! One final tip- don't get stiffed by the taxi driver from the airport. I was charged €33 upon arrival but only €20 on my departure. Both trips were at similar times in quiet traffic. It should cost between €20-25. Enjoy & have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel stylish and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Jenan
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four day stay in Madrid to celebrate my husband's 60th birthday. It was fantastic. We stayed at the Hotel Urban. The hotel is fabulous. The decor and ambience are stunning. The glass bar was under redecoration and had just been completed the day we left so we didn't experience that part of the facilities. The rest of the hotel was excellent. We asked for a quiet room and were allocated a room at the back of the hotel on the fourth floor.
