The view at the back of the hotel was of roof tops and the area was also exceptionally tidy which is impressive since most hotels do not seem to care about the presentatation of the rear of their hotels. It was stupendous. So quiet and peaceful. The breakfasts were an experience! We had an early morning breakfast at 6am and the room service was exceptional, served on time and really high quality food with lovely hot toast. Fantastic choice for the buffet and hot food was served exceptionally promptly. We found the staff attentive and exceptionally helpful even at 4.30am and 6am! The swimming pool is more like a plunge pool but it depends what you are visiting Madrid for. It is a city to be explored but a quiet area on the roof top to dip in the pool to cool off is about all that can be accommodated. We weren't interested but some people were and seemed to be enjoying the sunshine and the peace and quiet that area of the hotel afforded. One strange thing though, instead of a chocolate on your pillow at night you found a fried egg!! confectionary, but strange, we would have preferred a nice chocolate!!

Reviews.Title: “no substance”
Reviews.Author: DOHI
Reviews.Content: all style, no substance. small rooms, unfriendly staff. No concierge service ( and the staff very unhelpful) This may look stylish, but that is all this place has to offer ( and the swimming pool) - a hotel like this should offer a bit more to it´s customers. on the positive side - the pool is nice - but small.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: londonaustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Urban for a last minute weekend break. Arrived early on Saturday morning and was able to check in straight away. Hotel staff went out of their way to be helpful, helping us book restaurants, advising us on the best places to shop/sightsee etc. - we couldn't fault them. Our room was lovely - v. clean and modern and a great size bathroom too. No idea how people could think these rooms were tiny as in previous reviews. Roof terrace was great for sitting out in the sun and the pool was a nice feature. All in all it's a great hotel and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but over-designed”
Reviews.Author: Serial_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in Madrid and a stay at The Urban. I booked this hotel for its location and the outside swimming pool - something not on offer with any other hotel I could find in Madrid with a 5* rating. First impressions were a little bit of a let-down, but the staff at reception were nice enough. One huge bonus was that the hotel had purchased some excellent seats for the next days bullfight for a measily 16 Euros per person. I'd tried booking seats direct via various Spanish websites and they were charging 79 Euros per person for the same seats, so 5* to the Urban. I can't honestly say we were terribly impressed with our suite - at 500 Euros a night I would have expected something much larger. In fact it wasn't what most people would call a suite at all. Next, up to the roof to see the pool. What a huge let-down. I'm sorry, but this ain't no swimming pool - it's a childrens plunge pool with people sat right on the edge of it - 4 people each side and it's crowded. Personally I don't want to be in such close proximity to people gawping at me as I take a dip. Note the word DIP - you can't swim in it and the water only comes up to the waist at both ends of the pool. In the evening we ate in the Europa restaurant - some very interesting food though I think the chef may be trying a little too hard to be arty farty with the presentation and layering of flavours. We found some of the waiters a little surly and possibly should have a smidgen more of a grasp of the English language, or perhaps I'm wrong?! Overall I think this a hotel try to be like a Shrager hotel designed by Phillipe Starck, but it doesn't quite work. It's a little too over-designed. But I do think if you've got some cash and you're in your 20's or early 30's you'll love it here, especially on a Saturday night. It would appear this is the 'trendy' place to be on a Saturday, but it would be nice if the guests were given a little more priority at the bars instead of it being a free-for-all for outsiders to take over the place.

Reviews.Title: “Still probably the best option”
Reviews.Author: TravelSnob1
Reviews.Content: GOOD: *Location *Great, unique, fun hotel *Very happening place *Staff is excellent and very helpful BAD: *Bed linens are scratchy and terrible *Service requests made from the room weren't delivered *Top floor (2 story) rooms are great but we were awoken several times at night by people moving their chairs on the rooftop bar and the music didnt stop one night until midnight on a wednesday. They also clean up the bar at 4am when it closes and you can hear the clean up crew This is still the best option in madrid and i would definitely come back again but would be more careful with the room chosen. Awesome place overall!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent... but the food!”
Reviews.Author: AncoraMadrid
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and location. Sexiest room ever! Overall we enjoyed it very much. The food though was not up to our expectations (to put it mildy) and was definitely overpriced. We asked for a ham sandwich by the pool, and got 22€ worth of dry, burnt bread, chewy ham and some chips. We also had the €180 per person dinner on the roof. Service was great, but that was about it. The oysters were not sitting on ice but swimming in it. We had to RINSE them before eating them. The Iranian caviar left us completely indifferent and so on. If you are staying here, skip the food and enjoy everything else. The hotel is worth it and there are plenty of great restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great for short business trips”
Reviews.Author: Searle
Reviews.Content: The hotel urban is perfect for the business traveller or for those on a city break in Madrid. It is perfectly located so everything is in walking distance. The staff are really friendly and helpful and they make the stay special. There are a few things that let the hotel down. The major of which is the noise. The walls are paper thin so you can hear your neighbours tv, conversations, footsteps down the corridor and if you are in one of the many rooms overlooking one of the roads you get all the outside noise as well. If you value your sleep this is not the hotel for you. The other disappointment was the swimming pool which is best described as an adult sized paddling pool. And beware because after 8pm drinks more than triple in price on the terrace. A bottle of water costs 10 Euros and when we queried it we were told it was to keep the riff raff out and there were often complaints about the prices. The riff raff certainly weren't there and neither was anyone else. Overall comment: The staff make it special.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: mclachlan4321
Reviews.Content: An outstanding hotel in a great European City. The service was always second to none, and our junior suite was great, clean and comfortable. Only minor niggle was a noisy party in the bar one night, but apart from that, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Urban Hotel - Madrid”
Reviews.Author: saintba
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing trip in Spain. I spent about 10 days in Spain. I’ll post a trip report later when I have more time. I just got back. I’ve been to Europe dozens of times but this was my first trip to Spain and I was very impressed. I wasn’t aware of the massive tourism to Spain but it actually gets more tourists than the United States! It’s #2 in the world with about 60 million tourists per year! I booked the Urban Hotel ahead of time as I read great reviews of it and I heard it was modern and upscale. I booked a Junior Suite which was pricey at 350€ (u$s 472) per night. Very pricey but the room was very nice. I don’t have any complaints at all. It was a holiday and I like to pamper myself on holidays. The cheapest room they had was 250 € (u$s 338) per night for a normal room. They have 96 rooms in this modern hotel. My room was very nice with a plasma TV, very nice marble bathroom and high ceilings. The area was very nice and convenient and near the Banco de España Metro station. My room was very quiet. The service was good as well. I read a negative review after my trip on Trip Advisor but I didn’t have any complaints at all. I ordered room service very very late one night after coming back from a night out and they were prompt but the choice of menu isn’t that complete with mostly sandwiches late at night. I didn’t hit the bar but it was always lively late at night. If I had to do it over again I’d probably just book a normal room. I met up with someone that I met that was staying here and I saw her room and it was fine. Personally I would have preferred the apartment that I booked. I found it an amazing value for the room but if you are a hotel person than definitely this would be a consideration. Anyway, I had no problems at all and the service was good at the Urban Hotel. I’d recommend the normal room at 250€ vs. the bigger room as you probably won’t be in your room much. I was out and about all day. I made my booking directly at the hotels website at (--) All in all, I had a great trip in Spain. Madrid and Barcelona are both world class cities. If I didn’t live in Buenos Aires, I’d move to either Madrid or Barcelona as I really loved both.

Reviews.Title: “very poor”
Reviews.Author: sarah98
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews felt confident hotel urban would be a wonderful short break for my mum and I. Very impersonal service, small noisy room with 1 mattress which had a definite odour of urine. Cleaners kknocking and entering our room at 8.30 a.m. Honestly i find it unbelievable to write this! Heard an overamorous couple and thought they d entered our room it was so audible. Attempted to use the pool but it was closed for cleaning and very small more of a plunge pool. Also when asked for coffee / cafe latte at the glass bar i was served with an irish coffee. English was very poorly understood. geniunely could nt make this up!! Madrid is wonderful and its location is great but would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Travelling1girl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for several nights on a business trip and was very impressed. Check in was great with friendly staff who showed me to my room and explained how to work the lights, electric curtains etc. The room itself was very spacious, quite minimalist and modern and very clean. The bed was comfortable, the floor to ceiling windows made the room light and airy, the bathroom was a good size with separate bath and shower and of course a bidet as usual in Spain. Toiletries nicely presented in a mesh bag and there were robes and slippers as you would expect. What really earned this hotel a place in my heart was the bottle of wine and handwritten card waiting in the room on my arrival, a lovely personal touch and just what I needed after a day travelling and working. The location was good as far as I could tell, I didn't get out much but when I did it seemed quite central. My only criticism would be the room service menu (I never ate in the hotel). As a frequent business traveller I just want a choice of basic filling food to get me through until the next day, rather than impressive restaurant type food. That is purely personal though and something I generally find in 5* hotels so the typical customer of this hotel might think otherwise. I'd say expand the menu rather than change it. There are enough places to eat nearby, even for a lone female traveller, so this is a very minor issue.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: morevacation
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Urban in April 2007, and we agreed on the following review: 1) Location: next to all major musuems, restaurants, sites. Honestly, we walked to everything we wanted to see, drink, or eat. Perfect location. 2) Facilities: really cool - - glass eleveators, interesting art, funky music, great pre and post evening drinks at the Glass Bar. For the younger professional or for the type of traveller that enjoys a chic, modern "scene" - urban does the trick. Too early to enjoy the pool and top floor views, but it all looks amazing. I hear the restaurant on site is good, but I didn't experience it. However, I capped each evening at the Glass Bar. Lot of fun. 3) Rooms: modern, but yet very comfortable. The room was quiet and the electric blinds blocked all evidence of sunlight, thus we could sleep off our night of fun before venturing out again. Everything was high end - flat screen TV, cool lighting, etc. Bed was comfy. Climate control was perfect. 4) Service: front desk crew was always helpful, spoke very good English and were all professional. I did not make use of the concierge services, but upon arrival it was immediately offered to me. The doormen always wore a smile, and were pleasant. The only venue without friendly service was the Glass Bar - - had a lot of fun there, but the bartenders/staff were rude and indifferent. They always carried a cocky smirk and general lack of ethusiasm or interest in actually serving. Oh well. I really enjoyed the Urban. I have also stayed at the sleepy old Palace, but will never do so again. The Urban is alive with all sorts - professionals, tourists and even locals who enjoy the scene. Makes for a fun environment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly staff but not really a 5*”
Reviews.Author: didier_sept
Reviews.Content: I stayed at urban with my girlfriend for 3 days in April 07 and while we really enjoyed our stay I thought it fell a little short of some of our expectations. In some ways it looks like a smaller version of the Delano except that the main colors are black and brown. The location is really amazing, we stayed there for 3 days and we never had to take the tube or a bus. All the attractions we wanted to visist were within walking distance (Prado, Thyssen, Plaza Mayor, Retiro Park, Botanic gardens). The hotel design is quite nice, very quiet and relaxing , the artistic theme is quite pleasant. We had a room at second floor, with a terrible view (on a small street but mostly on a building 5meters away from the hotel - so we never opened the curtains), but very quiet. The room design is very nice, mostly in dark colors. Bathroom was very nice, lot of nice small touches and really powerful showers. Mattress was amazing. Great set up with the lights (a bit like at the Setai) The staff was really friendly but their english level was surprisingly low specifically at the front desk. We had some unexpected issues to get an Iron brought to our room or to get a French newspaper (which i never received). But the biggest disappointment came from the fact that the swimming pool, the roof terrace and the gym were unusable! I had read it in a previous review about the pool but for the gym it's not mentionned anywhere (and especially not on their website). Pool and roof terrace bar are closed and will only open in May, the gym is under work. Great but if i knew it beforehand i would have probably chosen another hotel... Apart from that the restaurant is nice and the glass bar (although by no means as trendy as advertised - too small for this and mostly attracting a crowd of executives) is really a nice spot.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in MADRID!!!!”
Reviews.Author: patriziablanco
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Urban last month and it was excellent!!! The best room, breakfast, lobby bar, concierge,location,etc.... We have stay in many hotels around the world:four seasons,mandarine, ritz carlton,et... but the Urban is another league. Perfect for honeymooners, just like us!!!

Reviews.Title: “Urban Spectacular - Carly, London”
Reviews.Author: CarlykinsGX
Reviews.Content: Wow, wow and wow again - what an excellent hotel! I didn't want to leave! One of the best, no correction, it is THE best hotel I have ever had the pleasure of staying in. So the swimming pool is under refurbishment, it was too chilly for a dip anyway, but other than that I must say this hotel and its staff were faultless through-out our 4 day stay. Centrally located, within walking distance of a popular drinking/clubbing square, the local metro system and tour buses if you are happy to get about on foot or the public transport system this is perfectly located in all instances. The hotel itself is a gothic gem, with Egyptian architecture and what I would describe as 'Beetlejuice'-esk (as in the movie) furniture in the lobby. It is like a work of art and every detail is perfectly designed and cared for. The ‘Glass Bar’, which as it the name indicates is wall to wall glass, is stylish, classy and you’ll be the envy of passers bar when inhabiting it. The staff are attentive, friendly, helpful and have a good sense of humor to boot. Everyone from the doorman to the reception desk staff to the bar and restaurant staff were absolutely wonderful! The hotel room was cozy but beautifully decorated with a contemporary feel of wood and dark brown leathers and I have never seen a shower head so big in all my life! This hotel deserves every compliment it receives and some! - keep up the good work Urban!

Reviews.Title: “Hip but cold”
Reviews.Author: Kirlu
Reviews.Content: We had a suite for 4 days which was OK. However, I would probably stay either at the Palace or the Ritz next time I go to Madrid - I think the value for money is better there. Biggest problem with Urban is that there is no outside view from the rooms. The good: Hip and trendy, good restaurant, excellent service and location, clean rooms, good room service, children wellcome. The bad: No outside window in rooms, only windows facing an inside lobby, bathrooms a little too high tech, rooftop terrace and pool only open from May to September - we didn't know.

Reviews.Title: “The most helpful and kind staff!”
Reviews.Author: oliveTx
Reviews.Content: We came upon this hotel by accident. My husband and I were unhappy with the hotel we were staying at and as soon as I walked into the lobby, I just knew this was it! I cannot say enough good things about the concierge. We stayed in the junior suite and it was worth every Euro! There's a big spa tub in the suite that is marvelous. If you call reception they bring you up an assortment of bath salts and oils to choose from in minutes. Also, the hotel is very chic and we were there during Madrid's Fashion Week and it was THE place to be for cocktails downstairs in the Glass Bar. We has a wonderful time and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Ultra modern, extra noisy”
Reviews.Author: Rubicon2
Reviews.Content: I booked my hotel package thru Luxurylink.com, wherein you book via auction and get many extras. This is what made my trip a little more exciting. The room was fine, with nice 5 star amenities, and it also included breakfast for all mornings and a dinner in their restaurant Europa Deco. It also included 2 Madrid Cards that allow you free access to the museums of Madrid. My only complaint was the noise level in the hotel. There are only hardwood floors throughout the entire hotel, so you can hear the clack clack clack of women in their high heels during the wee hours of the morning. Also, Madridians like to stay up to around 5am in the morning, so be prepared to hear patrons coming home anytime. Internet access was included free via ethernet cable, however there was a fee for wifi. The hotel was centrally located, and I have to agree that I never had to use the Metro since the Prado Museum and Palacio Real are within a leasurely stroll. While in town try and take a day trip to Toledo...definitely the highlight of my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Overhyped”
Reviews.Author: Manben
Reviews.Content: After reading the glowing reviews of Hotel Urban on TripAdvisor, maybe we had our expectations too high, but found the hotel very overhyped. While the location is amazing (we never used the subway once) and the decor chic and modern, the rooms are extremely tiny (the littlest rooms I have ever seen)-- in size they are akin to a freshman dorm room! The staff is not friendly (except the breakfast staff) and the restaurant food was just "ok"-- standard hotel fare. Overall we were not that impressed and have stayed in far nicer hotels in other cities and for the same price we paid at Urban. If you value chic and "hip" over value and friendliness, Urban is your place, but for us, we were a tad disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClayP
Reviews.Content: Good location, ultramodern hotel that is very trendy. Excellent rooftop and martini bars. Close to everything. Rooms are tiny though, food is somewhat average

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool!”
Reviews.Author: travelingnewlyweds
Reviews.Content: The hotel Urban is just that! Very modern! My husband and I felt like we were in a futuristic hotel! The hotel is clean, the decour is very interesting and cool and the staff is friendly. The location is right in town so you can walk to restaurants and shops. The rooms are small but very nice. As with other hotels we stayed in in Spain there is little room to unpack. Also like other hotels in Madrid, they have nice plasma tvs, but few English channels. The pool area is on the roof and is nice, with lots of action at night. however, the prices at the pool bar change drastically depending on the time you order! And they don't let you know until your bill comes! We had some beers one evening and the first 2 cost a fraction of the second 2 simply because of the time. There is also a swanky bar in the lobby which seemed popular (we didn't go in). As for the restaurant, we only ate in the hotel for one buffet breakfast which was very good, but not worth the cost unless you eat a lot. Overall, I would definately recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “As stylish as it comes”
Reviews.Author: Lemniot
Reviews.Content: This wasn't a case of style over matter. It is a superb hotel in a superb position with wonderful rooms. We had room 544 which I understand is not supposed to be one of the best rooms. However, for us it was really excellent. With rooftop views this excellently appointed room had everything. Very high tech with a handset for everything from the skylight a/c and curtains to the telly and the lights. No detail was overlooked and the quality of the linen, the bathroom and the service was just 10 out of 10. We went out one night to one of the best restuarants in town (incidentally a magnificent meal) and the owner was so impressed at our being cool enough to stay in "by far the most fashionable hotel in town", that free drinks kept appearing. The rooftop bar had just closed for the season, though they had opened it specially for a party of Norwegian guests the day before. It is truly a wonderful spot with state of the art furniture a lovely little pool (I guess arguably for little people as it has a depth of about 1.3 metres I think) sweet shaded alcoves and stunning views. We found the staff to be very friendly indeed and I often wonder when I read reviews in these forums if it is all about how you approach them. Perhaps it sometimes (not always) says more about you then them. No, this is an outrageously stylish place with superb achaeological scultptures throughout, including ones room. A small museum in the basement is a nice added touch. The breakfast is inevitably also stylish with excellent food and also plenty of quantity if you want it. Lovely situation. Slightly peevish about the extremely popular Glass Bar which is so successful that residents struggle to find a seat and the prices are as high as you might expect them to be. Good lively bar into the early hours. Lots of world famous footballers apparently. Liked the fact that, as a resident, one had free access to a very up to date PC and internet facility though at times the demand for this one machine meant you had to hang around for it to be vacated. They could ideally do with a second. The hotel is handy for everywhere - is near the Sol and Placa Mayor hubs of activity. Would heartily recommend it. Not cheap but probably the most exciting place in town!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joglig
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a weekend break at the Hotel Urban, it is absolutely perfect for a sophisticated romantic weekend. Wonderful cocktails at the Glass Bar and complementary sushi rather than tapas, great atmosphere. Prices less than in a similar London Hotel. Roof terrace perfect for some afternoon sun. Staff very friendly and helpful. Well located for shopping and tourist attractions. Avoid the Madrid Vision bus tour - the traffic is too bad and the commentary inaudible. Watch out for some dishonest taxi drivers (although most are fine). Don't waste time visiting the Las Rozas Village Outlet, not worth the journey. If you decide to soak up the atmosphere in the Plaza Mayor, don't be persuaded to buy the tapas, prices are high, food is poor. Fabulous italian restaurant about 50 yards up street from hotel, portions huge.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: bjsteadman
Reviews.Content: Hotel lobby and rooftop facilities were beautiful. Location was great. Desk staff was indifferent, restaurant and beverage prices were pretty steep and when I checked in, they had a much smaller room than requested. Would I stay here again? Probably not. I'd spend my money on a hotel with a friendlier and more helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Urban Oasis...”
Reviews.Author: Ssssss76
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me to Madrid for my 30th birthday. We had a wonderful time and the Urban Hotel was definately a treat. The central location, just up the road from Plaza de Sol, was ideal for sight-seeing in the day and eating a drinking in the evening. The intial smiley welcome from the door men was lovely after our journey. Our bags were taken to our room and we were given a good explanation of how all the different gadgets and lighting in the room worked. We were very pleased with the delicious bottle of Spanish red wine that waited for us as a 'welcome' from the management too. The room was stylish but very comfortable and the bathroom was well-designed. The roof-top bar is very luxurious and a great place for a sun-downer in the early evenings before heading out into town. The Glass Bar in the lobby is also nice, but we had mixed service which was disappointing (especailly considering the drinks prices!). But I can highly recommend the special Passionfruit cocktail! My only suggestion for improvement would be to have a fluent English speaker available at the reception desk. My limited Spanish did not stretch far enough for a couple of requests to be understood. One thing we did find irritating was that on checking out we were asked whether we had had breakfast that morning. We replied that we had not. The gentleman on reception then asked one the ladies (in Spanish - thinking we would not understand) behind the desk to call the restaurant to check! Once the restaurant confirmed that we had not had breakfast, our bill was ready! All in all, a lovely, comfortable, stylish hotel in a wonderful city with great thought put into making the guest feel special.

Reviews.Title: “chic but crazy drink prices”
Reviews.Author: GibbyInMadrid
Reviews.Content: Family stayed here while visitng me in Madrid and I'm relaying their experience and my own observations. Very nice, well planned rooms and amazing bathrooms. Outstanding service from all hotel staff. Competitive room prices, amazing attention to detail, beautiful design... The one and only problem is the bar. Good drinks, lovely atmosphere, but the drinks are more expensive than at the Ritz. I know of only one place in all of Madrdi (including clubs, bars, and restaurants) that charges more for a gin and tonic than does the Urban. Its slightly made up for by the fact that they serve awesome (but tiny!) tapas with your drinks, but my God!, I could have a very fine meal at some restaurants in Madrid for the price of one Bombay(not Saphire) and tonic.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic (and fancy) place in a great location, a little bit on the pricy side”
Reviews.Author: doktor_B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just great: Nice rooms, spectacular interior, nice roofdeck bar, very friendly staff, good location. I stayed for 5 nights on the 5th floor which was particularly nice because my room had skylights, adding more light to the room. I saw several rooms: they're all very nice, decorated with statues from a number of different cultures. The place is a 5 min walk from Pl. Santa Ana (with lots of bistros, restaurants) and about 10-15 min from the Prado. The roofdeck bar is really amazing: if you want to chill out with friendly people while overlooking beautiful Madrid, look no further. The bar is opened until 2 am every night and gets pretty packed on weekends. Bar and hotel are a little bit on the pricy side (1 beer = 10 euros), but hey, at least there's no cover charge! The breakfast buffet is one of the best that I've ever seen. I paid $209/night via hotelsrus[--] (incl. breakfast), if you reserve with the hotel directly it's more like $290 w/o breakfast. I will definitely stay here when I get back to Madrid. Check out the sandwiches at "Viva Madrid" around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Modern chic in historic Madrid”
Reviews.Author: octraveljunkie
Reviews.Content: The Urban is a great place to stay. From the minute you enter the front door, you are greeted by at least 2 people with smiling faces. The hotel's decor can be described as modern minimalist with a dash of zen. Although the rooms are small by American standards, the furnishings, the color schemes, the art pieces, the LCD tv plus the floor to ceiling windows with automatic drapes make you feel like you're at a mini suite at the Palms in Vegas. The vibe of the whole hotel is young, chic and hip. The club music that's filtered through speakers around the entire hotel is a nice touch that makes one feel energized in the morning. The breakfast buffet at the hotel is good although the small selection can get old. Getting around town from the hotel is a snap as this hotel is within walking distance to the main plaza's and the museums. To and from the airport is a snap, just take a cab. Its a 20 minute drive that will set you back around $20 plus tip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Urban”
Reviews.Author: shugski
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Urban for 3 nights from 24th May. The rooms are small but very high tech and the service is excellent. The highlight of the hotel has to be the roof terrace, there is a bar and a very small pool (more like a paddling pool than a swimming pool) with sun loungers and big bean bags. There is seating areas all around the roof with a mixture of sun loungers, bar tables and stools and plastic sofas. There is also a great bar on the ground floor. The location of the hotel is also great with lots of restaurants and attractions in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Up on the Roof!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Urban is without doubt a first class hotel. As mentioned in other reviews the rooms are on the small size for the rate, but with the amazing weather we enjoyed the rooftop terrace and pool (paddling pool) more than made up for this. The service was great, but as a young gay couple we did sometimes get inquisitive looks - not because we were gay, but because we were young and not dressed as formally as some of the other guests i feel. On the whole though a great stay, very central and absolutely immaculate. Make sure you spend the late afternoon with a bottle of wine lounging on the roof!!

Reviews.Title: “Small and perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - ok the rooms aren't the biggest you will stay in but they are well thought out and high quality. Staff are very helpful, the food good and great cocktails. Best thing however was the roof terrace - be sure to use it most people don't seem to - more fool them. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Urban is first rate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Hotel Urban in April 2006, and found it to be first rate. The staff was extraordinarily helpful. The decor was hip and downright exciting (though if you prefer traditional decor, this is not the place for you). The rooms are not actually as large as they appear in the hotel web site's photos, but they are configured to make maximum use of the space, and ours was quite comfortable. Only complaint is that the lighting, though thoughtfully designed, is a bit dim for reading. The location is excellent -- just a few blocks from both the major museums in one direction and the Plaza Major in the other. The subway is close by. The bar serves a late breakfast from 11-12:30, which was great when we wanted to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Very Swank”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very cool place! The decor is fabulous. This is a place for people who like the finer things in life and want to feel young and hip. The Glass Bar is a great place to enjoy music and have some drinks. The rooms were beautifully decorated with modern finishes although a bit small, especially after being at the Mirasierra Suites Hotel that had the largest standard room I've ever seen. Bottom line if you want to be in the center of it all, this is a fine choice.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and good ubication”
Reviews.Author: Bussines-CA
Reviews.Content: I spend part of my Honeymoon at The Urban; they have very modern rooms, in my case, 2 LCD TV. The hotel has a disco feeling and the staff is very helpful. If you are going to Madrid and $200+ the night is good to you, don't be afraid to reserve, you would not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stuff.”
Reviews.Author: mulletamoeba
Reviews.Content: nipped over to madrid recently for a couple of days with the girl - this is a beautiful and interestingly thought-out property. Good - Great location. Friendlieness and lack of pretension, excellent level of english-speaking, cracking breakfast. Rose and bottle of wine left in the room the first night was appreciated. Our room looked down on the busy calle san jeronimo but was totally insulated against street noise. Bad - Not much. Staff uniforms: black jackets (smart) with a dark wine polo - very odd - did not detract too much from their competence. English explanations of the artistic pieces would be reasonable. Gym not yet open, complimentary smart car advertised on web site not available. recommended. its a nice spot.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further for affordable class in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: denbydaler
Reviews.Content: Don't let the dull name of the hotel put you off as in reality it mixes style with real class and couldn't be more conveniently located for central Madrid. Rooms aren't the biggest but are stylish enough, with plasma TV, marble bathroom etc. The bar is always poular despite the prices and reports suggested that the restaurant was also top class although the prices were high and we chose local restuarants for both breakfast and evening meals. The pool on the roof looked the part although 3-5 degree C temps killed any chance of trying it for us. For that special few days in Madrid, look no further than the Urban.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in a superb location!”
Reviews.Author: GiancarloRoma
Reviews.Content: Period: 27-30 jan (3 nigths); Price: €180 per nigth (double without breakfast). Very convinient location in the heart of the city: you can reach almost everything with a short walhing (from 1 min to Thyssen Bornemizsa to 15 min to Palacio Real). Very modern structure ... totally "minimalistic". Friendly staff ... good room with beautifull bathroom ... excellent room service. Fantastic rooftop with a pool (ok it isn't an olimpic pool ... but considering where you are and the reduced hotel's size ... it's big enough! Good hip and trendy restaurant (Europa deco) ... but the same menu from his sister/brother hotel Villa Real East 47 ... and a little bit pricy! Giancarlo

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: RJB
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, a very successful match of state-of-the-art modern design (most visible in the bathrooms) and antiques (the owner of the chain is an archeologist). Our suite had five antique Hindu figures in a glass case and an (empty) antique Chinese armoire, which looked surprisingly good alongide a bathroom taken straight from a style magazine and 2 plasma TV's. It's not just style, either - the restaurant downstairs was excellent, albeit expensive, and the bar is very hip. Location is excellent, equidistant to the Prado and the main shopping area at Sol metro. (If you arrive by Metro, Sevilla is the nearest station - walk down one of the side streets to Jeronimo where the hotel is.) There were a few gripes. Housekeeping walked into our room one morning despite the 'do not disturb' sign. On Sunday they delivered exactly the same issue of the same newspaper as on Saturday, since that paper did not have a Sunday edition!! The 'free' morning coffee tray came with an unexpected Euro 3 room service charge. And our suite had no daylight, since it overlooked the internal atrium. This avoided traffic noise and, in gloomy January, was not a problem, but in a sunnier month I would have been annoyed. Don't let any of this put you off, though. This hotel will look very dated in five years time, but for now is state of the art. If you want a suite (which will actually be an open-plan junior suite), we booked on Opodo - the hotels own website doesnt seem to sell suites online. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great looks, service, location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great-looking, a modern sleek earth-tone look with interesting art. My room was quite small with little closet space, but was attractive and cozy with the most modern amenities. The hotel service was simply excellent. The concierges did everything for me from obtaining last-minute tickets to the Saturday night bullfight, to lending me their converter so I could charge appliances. They were invariably pleasant and spoke very good English. The food in the restaurant is very good. A few words about the location: it is quite central and is particularly good for museum sightseeing, as the three major museums are each within a 5 to 10 minute walk. However it is also noisy. I was in a fourth floor room overlooking a side alley, and the combination of noise from the street and the bar downstairs was a real annoyance. Do ask for a room at the back of the hotel and on a high floor if you aren't a heavy sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel, modern cool design”
Reviews.Author: wantatrip
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Stayed there last week, after a week of 3 and 4 stars around Spain was nice to settle into a quality hotel with excellent service. Great designs, very cool, would definitely stay here again. Good location (though took a bit of time to find on the one way system). Didn't try the bar and restaurant though both were packed and had a good buzz the night (a Thursday) we were there. Good service? When we came down early (5:30am for an early flight) first thing asked the reception if our car could be bought up (valet parking) - and was told it was already ready - they had taken a note the day before when I asked them what time I needed to leave for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “funky, cool, Urban”
Reviews.Author: bombizer
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. Blew me away when we walked in - brilliant doormen, service, receptionist, not to mention the decor and the Glass Bar. Wow-factor rooms with expensive decor and bathrooms with accessories to fit even the most demanding girls dreams. Fantastic central location, stunning interior design and cool roof terrace away from the dirt of madrid streets. We loved it so much we nearly didn't see much of Madrid at all. Expensive - and rightly so!

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the highly praised rooftop terrace seemed to be for everyone exept the hotel guests, pushy waiters came along every two minutes "offering" another drink . the pool is tiny and the water cloudy.after having our used wineglasses in the room for 3 days we finally called room service to bring clean ones , and to bring 2. bath towel . the bathtub had a beautifull glass slide door, unfortunately it was hanging loose and the corner was dangerously chipped . staff at reception was professional but arrogant .ongoing partys on the rooftop and in downstairs bar might be enjoyable for outsiders , but for hotelguests who are in madrid on business and want to sleep- a real nuisance.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PNMLAW
Reviews.Content: This is an ultra modern hotel, with lots of quirky touches (such as the art work in the room and funny lighting). It was quiet, it was clean, and it was cool. The pool may be the best in the city, with giant bean bags around the edge. Outside of a Ritz or Four Seasons, I have never seen better toiletries. Noone picks their hotel because of the shampoo, but good grief -- that was some cool stuff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Service & facilities first class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Urban for my 40th Birthday. The room we were allocated was small, so we asked for this to be changed, which was done without any hitch. We stayed on the 4th Floor at the front of the hotel, and can say we did not find any problem with noise. The room was large, comfortable with a sofa, dressing table and enough wardrobe space. Bathroom/Shower facilities very good, and loved the marble sink! Slippers, bath robes in room and bath salts which arrived every evening when they came to turn the beds down for the evening. This was second visit to Madrid, so we knew the hotel was in an excellent location. Fab bar as you turn left out of hotel, 5 mins walk, lots of clocks above the bar area! The staff at the hotel could not be more helpful. Swimming pool and terrace were open. Small pool but enough to cool you down. We are hoping to visit Madrid again in August and will be staying at the Urban again without a doubt. Well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Try another hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very noisy, average service. We stayed 3 nights the staff were unable to fix the airconditioning for the entire stay and were unable to offer any alternatives as they were full. The swimming pool and deck area appeared to be finished but were unable to use, despite promotions stating that all services were available. Despite its problems it is very close to the museums. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern "W like" hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Madrid was the first stop on our vacation and we couldn't have picked a better place to kick off our trip. The rooms were comfortable and quiet (our room was on the back side of the hotel and we couldn't hear a thing). The room amenities were top notch including a flat screen tv, dimming lights, and a spacious bathroom. We were greeted with a bottle of wine and a rose which I thought was a classy touch, they also offered bath salts on a cart in the afternoon (something I've never experienced at a hotel before). I was a little disappointed that the roof top area was not up and running yet since we would have enjoyed the pool. The hotel bar is the place to be seen, if that's your thing, we were too jet lagged to really enjoy it. We appreciated the free internet access in the lobby. Overall, it's a great hotel and if we return to Madrid, we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 nights and loved every minute of it.breakfast good,bar good and the bedrooms were very modern decor ,large and very comfortable.staff were very helpful and friendly and i would definetely stay here again.for me the best assest was the hotel location which was central to everything .

Reviews.Title: “Don’t expect five stars service”
Reviews.Author: mhellberg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice, the rooms are wonderful and the hotel is well located, but the service is not what you would expect in a five star hotel, I used the cultural package which includes a 4 hours use of a car, I reserved it after my Saturday breakfast for use Sunday morning. When I returned Saturday in the afternoon the reservation had been cancelled with a bad excuse of the car already being booked even though they checked it at the time of my reservation, no alternatives were offered by the very impolite staff.

Reviews.Title: “One of Madrid's Best”
Reviews.Author: keithandsau
Reviews.Content: Hotel Urban is stylish and duly deserve its 5 stars status. Its is in a great location near to the Puertos de Sol and not very far from Plaza Mayor. We have just come back from a 4 day trip in Madrid and can highly recommend the Hotel Urban. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the bar”
Reviews.Author: marcnshirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from wonderful long weekend in Madrid. We did not stay at this hotel (stayed the Ritz), but found this hotel by accident. We skipped into the bar for a drink at around 5pm,met some amazing people, encountered some of the friendliest hotel staff ever, had great snacks, and the most wonderfully prepared drinks. Dragged ourselves out at around midnight (i think). Im looking forward to our return to Madrid, and we will be stopping at the Urban...cant wait. A big thanx to the staff...wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “best choice in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: zane123
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 5 days stay at the Urban Hotel in Madrid. Brand new, beautifully decorated, minimalistic, stylish, clean and comfortable. (all the way to the fluffy towels and complimentary wine bottle) The staff is very friendly and helpful. There is a computer at the lobby for the guests at no charge and all the wireless capabilities at your room. The buffet breakfast which was included in our reservation offered a lot of choices and was nicely presented at the artsy looking restaurant. It is located walking dstance to the Prado Museum, Reina Sofia, Recoleto Park, Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor and the train station. The only time we needed a taxii was to go to the airport. If I have to point out a minus it was the street noise at night (we asked to be change to a room facing the inside which was promptly taken care). I also recommend the Italian restaurand a couple of steps to the left of the hotel. (Great pasta, fresh sauces!). This hotel choice definitely made our stay in Madrid perfect. We will certainly stay here next time.
